column2: What? Are you cowards?! Lok'tar ogar!
column4: Was seid ihr, Feiglinge?! LOK'TAR OGAR!

column2: In the area known as "Gorgrond", a forested region with large spikey outcroppings, overgrown wildthorns, and brutish creatures, we have discovered a strange people: a group of orcs known as the Laughing Skull Clan. The most distinguishing trait of these people is their tendency to laugh, riding on chitin-shelled wasps and oversized insects. They are fond of a type of mask that they wear, which is made from chitin or bone. It seems as though that they may become good allies - if we are to ignore past indiscretions. Their leader, an ogre by the name of Mogor, is willing to help us as a gesture of goodwill. Should we accept their help? The Laughing Skulls are rather unsavory... can we really ally them?

Au�erdem scheinen sie die Horde ebenfalls zu hassen. Sie k�nnten passable Verb�ndete abgeben. Ihr Anf�hrer, der Oger Mogor, hat Ner'zhul das Buch des Medivh gestohlen und ist bereit, es uns als Geste des guten Willens zu �bergeben. Aber sollten wir ihr Geschenk annehmen? Dieser Ork-Clan wirkt verr�ckt und absto�end... k�nnen wir uns wirklich mit ihnen verb�nden?

column2: The Laughing Skull clan and their unhinged leader have agreed to help us. Their way of fighting is truly frightening. Even in their small numbers, the warriors of their clan are more dangerous than any of our soldiers. It is worth celebrating that these insane orcs are on our side.

Und mit ihrer ungew�hnlichen Art, Krieg zu f�hren, wirklich be�ngstigend ist, erwies sich dieser Clan trotz seiner geringen Anzahl als st�rker und gef�hrlicher als viele unserer Truppen. Man kann sich nur freuen, dass diese verr�ckten Orks an unserer Seite stehen...

column2: The Laughing Skull clan and their unhinged leader have agreed to help us. Even though they drank the demon's blood, they cry havoc for war! It was decided that it would be wise to leave them at the Dark Portal, promising them land in the future. They will be able to hold off rival orcish clans that reside near the portal.

column2: Information was received about the appearance of Deathwing on Draenor. Apparently, he has rewoven his alliance with some members of the Horde, and even taken possession of a powerful demonic artifact! The great beast overcame the fortifications of the Horde and flew towards the Blade's Edge Mountains, where he most likely decided to wait out the heat of the upcoming battles.\nPart of the expedition will go after the Aspect of Death, and bring him to justice for his crimes. The main forces of the Horde will focus on the traitors. The bountiful forests of Terokkar lie ahead of us, the edge of the woods already visible. Our leader's people will be able to find allies there for further offensives against the Black Temple, the main stronghold of Ner'zhul's army.

Die Bestie �berwand die Befestigungen der Horde und flog gen Schergrat, wo er h�chstwahrscheinlich die Hitze der bevorstehenden Schlachten abwarten wollte.\nDer Hauptteil der Expeditionsstreitmacht jagt den Aspekt des Todes und wird ihn seiner gerechten Strafe zuf�hren, w�hrend der Gro�teil der Horde sich auf die Verr�ter konzentriert. Die gro�en W�lder von Terokkar liegen vor uns, der Waldrand ist bereits in Sicht. Unsere Anf�hrer werden dort Verb�ndete finden k�nnen, um auf den schwarzen Tempel, die Hauptfestung Ner'zhuls, weiter vorzusto�en.

column2: Though it took some time, we managed to locate Deathwing and his despicable brood. The dragon disappeared slightly to the north of the lands possessed by the Laughing Skull, among the peaks of the Blade's Edge mountains. The mountains are also inhabited by the gronn: huge semi-intelligent creatures, distant relatives of ogres.\nGruul, the lord of the gronns, saw how we fought with the creations of the mad aspect, and is ready to help us in the battle with Deathwing. But can we trust the ancestors of the ogres, and of ourselves?
column4: Es hat eine Weile gedauert, aber letztlich haben wir Todesschwinge und seine verabscheuungsw�rdige Brut gefunden. Diese Berge sind von den Gronns besiedelt, riesigen halb-intelligenten Kreaturen, die entfernte Verwandte der Oger zu sein scheinen.\NGruul, der Herr der Gronns, sah uns gegen die Kreaturen des verr�ckten Aspekts k�mpfen und ist bereit, uns im Kampf gegen ihn zu unterst�tzen. Aber k�nnen wir den Vorfahren der Oger, und unseren eigenen, trauen?

column2: On the way to the Black Temple, our soldiers marched into the forests of Terokkar, one of the few places on Draenor which has largely avoided the destruction wrought by fel magic. This land is home to the Gordunni Clan, one of the few ogre clans who maintained their sanity after the desecration of Draenor. They still follow the traditions of the Gorian Empire and keep to themselves.\nThe nearby forests are also home to the mysterious arakkoa, as well as groups of the Shattered Hand clan. They practice dark magic and offer sacrifices to the gods, like the Loa. Nevertheless, some of them are in contact with other races.\nMaybe one of them will agree to help us in the upcoming battle?
column4: Auf dem Weg zum schwarzen Tempel marschierten unsere Krieger durch die W�lder von Terokkar, einen der wenigen Orte auf Draenor, die bisher nur wenig Schaden durch die d�monische Felmagie zu erleiden hatten. Sie folgen immer noch den Traditionen des gorianischen Imperiums und halten sich zur�ck.\nIn den nahegelegenen W�ldern verstecken sich die geheimnisvolle Arakkoa, sowie der Clan der zerschmetterten Hand. We do not know what will happen to Draenor in the near future, but many elders say that it is doomed, and it is important to protect our new home from the coming threat.

column2: The people of Stormwind lived in peace and prosperity on the continent of Azeroth for many years. Now Stormwind is facing a new deadly danger in the Black Morass. A gate has opened to another world - Draenor. This world of wild savagery - the home to orcs, ogres, and many other creatures - is dying. Orcs under the rule of demons and the Shadows Council have been slowly perverted and distorted by the Fel magic affecting all of the races inhabiting Draenor. Their world can no longer support the large population of orcs. Driven by the desire to find a new home and a thirst for blood, many orcs, led by the leaders of the clans and a single head of the Horde, seek to go through the Dark Portal. Now, clans of orcs and ogres erect fortifications in the Black Morass and are preparing to take the first steps as conquerors on Azeroth in search of their destiny.
column3: Les humains du Royaume de Hurlevent coulaient des jours heureux et prosp�res, prot�g�s par les Chevaliers de Hurlevent et les Clercs de l'Abbaye du Comt�-du-nord, mais d�sormais, venus tout droit des profondeurs des Morasses Noires, un nouveau danger mortel menace la paix et la tranquillit� de ces contr�es. Un porte s�est ouverte vers un autre monde: Draenor, un monde bestial, o� la barbarie r�gne, mais un monde en lente d�g�n�rescence. Les orcs, sous la coupe des d�mons et du Conseil des Ombres, ont �t� lentement corrompus et pervertis par l��nergie gangren�e, affectant par la m�me occasion toutes les autres races peuplant ce monde. Rong�s par une soif de sang inextinguible, par l�obligation de fuir leurs terres ancestrales et par un d�sir ardent de combattre caus� par la corruption, de nombreux orcs, unis sous la banni�re de la Horde, cherchent � traverser le portail et d�ferler sur Azeroth. D�sormais, de multiples clans orcs et ogres �rigent des fortifications dans les Morasses Noires et se pr�parent � faire leurs premiers pas en tant que conqu�rants recherchant leur destin�e.
column4: Die Einwohner von Stormwind leben seit vielen Jahren auf dem Kontinent Azeroth in Frieden und Wohlstand. Aber nun schwebt Stormwind in h�chster Gefahr, da sich im schwarzen Morast ein Tor zu einer anderen Welt ge�ffnet hat - nach Draenor. Diese Welt der wilden Barbaren, Heimat von Orks, Ogern und vielen anderen Kreaturen, ist dabei zugrunde zu gehen. Orks unter der Herrschaft von D�monen und dem Schattenrat wurden langsam pervertiert und verzerrt durch die Fel-Magie, die alle Rassen, die Draenor bewohnen, betrifft. Diese Welt kann ihre gro�e Bev�lkerung nicht mehr lange ern�hren. Angetrieben von dem Wunsch, eine neue Heimat zu finden und ihren Durst nach Blut zu stillen, neigen viele Orks, angef�hrt von ihren Clanf�hrern und dem Kriegsh�uptling, dazu, durch das dunkle Portal zu gehen. Nun bauen Ork- und Ogerclans Festungen im schwarzen Morast und bereiten sich darauf vor, ihre ersten Schritte als Eroberer Azeroths zu unternehmen, auf der Suche nach ihrem Schicksal.

column2: The kingdom of Stormwind is one of the seven kingdoms of men. Its inhabitants always differed from the rest of mankind in their perseverance and iron will. Their King Llane Wrynn has ruled his people in peace and prosperity for eighteen years already. Even during the last century, Stormwind experienced two major wars: the war with the gnolls and the war with the gurubashi trolls, but it was able to withstand its enemies and strengthen its positions in the south of Azeroth. But a fateful confluence of circumstances may lead Stormwind to the largest and most destructive war it has ever faced, which will leave a once-powerful kingdom in ruins.
column4: Das K�nigreich Stormwind ist eines der sieben K�nigreiche der Menschen. Seine Bewohner zeichneten sich schon immer durch ihre Sturheit und ihren eisernen Willen aus. Ihr K�nig Llane Wrynn regiert sein Volk seit achtzehn Jahren in Frieden und Wohlstand. Allein w�hrend des letzten Jahrhunderts hat Stormwind zwei gro�e Kriege �berstanden: den Krieg gegen die Gnolle und den Krieg gegen die Trolle des Gurubashi-Stamms. Trotzdem konnte es seinen Feinden im S�den Azeroths widerstehen und seine Position deutlich st�rken. Aber eine verh�ngnisvolle Verkettung von Umst�nden k�nnte Stormwind in den gr��ten und verheerendsten Krieg f�hren, den es je gef�hrt hat, und der das einst m�chtige K�nigreich ruinieren k�nnte.

column2: Blackhand the "Destroyer", the chieftain of the Blackrock clan, the largest clan, a legendary Orcish warrior and commander. After spreading the Fel among the orcs, he and his brothers fought against the Draenei, with the support of the Shadow Council and Gul'dan himself. While Warchief of the Horde, he became but a pawn of the council due to his lust for power and his imprudence, forsaking the traditions and beliefs of his ancestors and people. Blackhand led the orcs to victory against the draenei, leading a bloodthirsty horde from Hellfire Citadel to the Karabor. Draenor was dominated by the Horde, though at cataclysmic cost. With their home corrupted and shattered, Gul'dan found a new world to invade: Azeroth. It was Blackhand who led the Orcish clans through the Dark Portal to invade Azeroth, though death was in his pursuit.

column2: Upon the death of High King Modimus Anvilmar, the fierce tensions that permeated the Ironforge boiled over. War subsequently broke out between the three rival clans and all of Ironforge's resources were mobilised in support of one clan or another. Bloody and destructive, the war raged on for many years before the Bronzebeard clan, the most numerous and martial of the three, successfully drove the other two from the city, claiming it for themselves. Bitter from their defeat, the Wildhammer and Dark Iron clans left the region and established their own states nearby. Although a period of relative peace ensued, it proved to be short-lived. Unable to come to terms with his clan's defeat, Sorcerer-Thane Thaurissan now prepares his Dark Iron dwarves to launch a massive, two-pronged invasion of the other two clans' respective territories, seeking vengeance for their previous defeat.
column4: Nach dem Tod des Hochk�nigs Modimus Ambossar kochte die Spannung in Eisenschmiede �ber. Zwischen den drei rivalisierenden Clans brach ein Krieg aus und alle Ressourcen von Eisenschmiede wurden zur Unterst�tzung des einen oder anderen Clans mobilisiert. Der blutige und zerst�rerische Krieg tobte mehrere Jahre, bis der Bronzebartclan, der zahlreichste und kriegerischste der drei, die anderen beiden Clans aus der Stadt vertrieb und die Herrschaft f�r sich beanspruchte. Bitter �ber die Niederlage verlie�en der Wildhammerclan und der Dunkeleisenclan die Region und gr�ndeten ihre eigenen Staaten in der N�he. Obwohl es eine Periode relativen Friedens gab, w�hrte diese nicht lange. Unf�hig die Niederlage seines Clans zu akzeptieren, bereitete Magierthane Thaurissan eine Invasion gegen die L�ndereien der beiden anderen Clans vor, auf der Suche nach Rache f�r die vorige Niederlage.

column2: Minutes of existence in this piece of ice last for eternity, though only seven days ago you were the greatest shaman of your people. But now you have been turned to disembodied lichdom, bound in the eternal ice of Icecrown. This is the punishment of the Burning Legion for your impudence. You have retained freedom of action, but the council of the nathrezim has been assigned to watch over you, following your every step, a puppet. The dreadlords conveyed to you the will of their master: call the Legion to Azeroth, no matter the cost! If you disobey, the demons will easily destroy your soul, without leaving a grain of the former Ner'zhul behind. We'll have to obey... for now.
column4: Die Minuten ziehen sich in diesem St�ck Eis ewig hin, obwohl erst sieben Tage vergangen sind, seit Ihr der gr��te Schamane Eures Volkes wart. Nun aber seid Ihr zu einem k�rperlosen unsterblichen Lich geworden, gebunden an das ewige Eis von Eiskrone. Dies ist die Bestrafung der brennenden Legion f�r Eure Vermessenheit. Ihr habt Eure Handlungsfreiheit behalten, aber der Rat der Nathrezim wird jeden Eurer Schritte �berwachen, wie bei einer Marionette. Die Schreckenslords �bermittelten Euch den Willen ihres Herrn: Ruft die Legion nach Azeroth, koste es was es wolle! Solltet Ihr Euch widersetzen, werden die D�monen Ihre Seele ausl�schen, ohne auch nur einen Hauch des ehemaligen Ner'zhul �brig zu lassen. Ich muss ihnen wohl gehorchen... f�r's Erste...

column2: The path of the shadow priest is a path steeped in the Void and dark magic, one of the fundamental forces in our universe. The Void is the home of terrifying monstrosities, and only the strongest of spirits can preserve their mind and life after being exposed to it. Shadow priests have a varied and very dangerous set of skills: they can distort the mind and body of living beings, causing pain and insanity. Despite all of this, if you adhere to the balance between dark and light, you might control this dangerous magic for the benefit of yourself and others.
column4: Der Weg des Schattenpriesters ist durchdrungen von der dunklen Magie der Leere, einer der fundamentalen Kr�fte des Universums. Die Leere ist Quelle schrecklicher Monstrosit�ten und nur die st�rksten Geister k�nnen ihre Vernunft und ihr Leben bewahren, nachdem sie ihr ausgesetzt waren. Die Schattenj�ger verf�gen �ber gro�e und sehr gef�hrliche F�higkeiten: sie k�nnen den Geist und den K�rper von Lebewesen verzerren und diese durch unsagbare Schmerzen in den Wahnsinn treiben. Wenn Ihr das Gleichgewicht zwischen Dunkelheit und Licht wahrt, k�nnt Ihr diese gef�hrliche Magie zu Eurem eigenen Vorteil nutzen.

column2: You have completed your training on the path of the shadow priest. Now it is up to you to decide what to do with your newfound powers of the Void.
column4: Ihr habt Euer Training zum Schattenpriester abgeschlossen. Nun liegt es ganz allein an Euch, was Ihr mit dieser neu gewonnenen Macht der Leere anfangt.

column2: Your previous gods turned their back on you after you embraced the Void. The emptiness slowly fills your soul, displacing your previously earnest and righteous disposition with a far more sinister and callous one.
column4: Eure bisherigen G�tter haben sich von Euch abgewandt, nachdem Ihr die Leere angenommen habt. Sie f�llt langsam Eure Seele, verdr�ngt alles, was Euch einst am Heiligsten war, und l�sst nur Raum f�r Wahnsinn und Grausamkeit.

column2: No! Everything must be in balance!
column4: Nein, alles muss im Gleichgewicht sein!

column2: I saw the true face of the abyss!
column4: Ich habe das wahre Gesicht der Leere gesehen!

column3: Apprendre la magie des ombres par soi-m�me

column2: Your allies capture all the counties they claim or have captured, if they made a significant contribution to the war.\n

column2: Draenor continues to die slowly. Now none of the orcs have a desire to remain on a perishing world. Those who were left on Draenor are now hungry, sick and insane... but have crossed the line between the worlds. Among them are the most bloodthirsty bands of orcs, who inspire fear and respect in other, less virulent clans. The clans of the Burning Blade and the Dragonmaw will overwhelm anyone who stands in the way of the Horde.
column4: Draenor stirbt weiterhin langsam. Inzwischen hat kein Ork mehr den Wunsch, in einer untergehenden Welt zu bleiben. Diejenigen, die auf Draenor zur�ckgelassen wurden, sind nun hungrig, krank und dem Wahnsinn nahe... und haben die Grenze zwischen den Welten �berschritten. Unter ihnen befinden sich die blutr�nstigsten Orkclans, die Angst und Respekt in den andere Clans wecken. Die Clans der Brennenden Klinge und der Drachenmalclan werden jeden vernichten, der der Horde im Weg steht.

column2: Past wars took the lives of many bloodthirsty warriors and warlocks, who would be very useful now. Fortunately, you came across texts on the ancient art of necromancy, which allows you to return the dead to life or something like that. These lifeless warriors will not feel pain nor fear, and their thirst for death can be compared only with natural demonic cruelty.
column4: Die vergangenen Kriege haben das Leben vieler blutr�nstiger Krieger und Hexenmeister gefordert, die jetzt sehr n�tzlich w�ren. Gl�cklicherweise seid Ihr auf Texte �ber die uralte Kunst der Nekromantie gesto�en, die es Euch erm�glichen, die Toten wieder zum Leben zu erwecken oder so �hnlich. Diese leblosen Krieger werden weder Schmerz noch Angst empfinden, und ihr Durst nach Tod kann nur mit der nat�rlichen d�monischen Grausamkeit verglichen werden.

column3: Nous n'avons pas besoins de cadavres rampants�!

column2: Today one of your nathrezim masters appeared before you, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName]. He has urged you to continue your summoning of the Burning Legion, and asked you to expedite the execution of your plans. "You must find the source of power required for the portal as soon as possible. My lord does not wish to delay our fateful hour any longer" he said, and then vanished as suddenly as he had appeared.
column4: Heute ist einer Eurer Nathrezim-Aufseher, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], an Euch herangetreten. Er forderte Euch auf, die Beschw�rung der brennenden Legion nicht hinauszuz�gern und forderte Euch auf, die Ausf�hrung Eurer Pl�ne zu beschleunigen. �Ihr m�sst schnellstm�glich eine f�r das Portal geeignete Machtquelle finden. Mein Meister will nicht l�nger auf die Stunde des Schicksals warten�, sagte er und verschwand so pl�tzlich, wie er erschienen war.

column2: One of your nathrezim masters, named [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], has once again appeared before you. [target_dreadlord.GetSheHeCap] was quite calm and reserved, but [target_dreadlord.GetHerHis] eyes were burning with fury. [target_dreadlord.GetSheHeCap] remained silent for several minutes before breaking the tension and uttered [target_dreadlord.GetHerHis] warning in a melodic voice. "If you do not fulfill your destiny, [Root.GetFirstName], then I promise you that you will spend all eternity in suffering locked in this armor!" After the threat was delivered, the messenger vanished.\nThe Legion's patience is at its end. If you do not wish to be subjected to the wrath of the Legion, you must fulfil their will.
column4: Einer Eurer Aufseher, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], ist heute an Euch herangetreten. [target_dreadlord.GetSheHeCap] war ziemlich ruhig und zur�ckhaltend, aber in [target_dreadlord.GetHerHis]en Augen loderte die Wut. Ein paar Minuten lang herrschte klare Stille, bis [target_dreadlord.GetSheHe] ausspie: �Wenn Ihr Euren Zweck nicht erf�llt, [Root.GetFirstName], dann verspreche ich Euch, dass Ihr die ganze Ewigkeit damit verbringen werden, in dieser R�stung eingeschlossen Leid zu erfahren!� Damit verschwand [target_dreadlord.GetSheHe].\nDie Geduld der Legion ist am Ende. Wenn Ihr nicht den vollen Zorn der brennenden Legion abbekommen wollt, m�sst Ihr ihren Willen erf�llen.

column2: All your nathrezim masters have come to you. They were furious, eyes alight with fire. ''You let us down, [Root.GetFirstName]!'' As [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName] finished speaking, you felt a terrible agony in your soul. If you had been alive, you would have quickly lost consciousness from the pain and would cease to be tormented - but alas, you are not, and will be eternally damned. ''And what's worse... you lied to the Legion!''
column4: All Eure Nathrezim-Aufseher erschienen vor Euch. Sie waren aufgebracht und die Wut loderte in ihren Augen. �Ihr habt versagt, [Root.GetFirstName]!� Kaum hatte [Target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName] den Satz beendet, erlittet Ihr schreckliche Qualen. Wenn Ihr noch am Leben w�rt, h�ttet Ihr bereits das Bewusstsein verloren und aufgeh�rt zu leiden. �Und was noch schlimmer ist... Ihr habt die Legion verraten!�

column2: One of your nathrezim masters has come to you. "[Root.GetFirstName], I believe we are not familiar with one another. My name is [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], and I am to keep watch so that you do not carry out anymore nonsense, and to ensure that you fulfil your destiny. You must aid in bringing the Burning Legion to this world, and if you don't, my brothers and me will do everything to turn your life into a hell." After a brief pause [target_dreadlord.GetSheHe] added "I hope we understood each other." After speaking, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName] disappeared.

Mein Name ist [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName] und ich werde darauf achten, dass Ihr keinen weiteren Unsinn mehr anstellt und die Mission ausf�hrt. Ihr m�sst die brennende Legion in diese Welt bringen und wenn Ihr Euch weigert, werden meine Br�der und ich alles tun, um Euer Leben in eine H�lle zu verwandeln.� Nach einer kurzen Pause f�gte [target_dreadlord.GetSheHe] hinzu: �Ich hoffe, wir haben uns verstanden.� Mit diesen Worten verschwand [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName].

column3: Une visite des Seigneurs de l'effroi

column2: You have done extraordinarily well. All of your former nathrezim masters are dead, incapacitated, or in captivity. The Burning Legion can no longer control you through the power of the dreadlords, and you are no longer required to do the will of the Legion. Now no one will prevent the Scourge from fulfiling its true potential.
column4: Ihr habt Euch unfassbar gut geschlagen. All Eure Nathrezim-Aufseher sind tot, unsch�dlich gemacht oder in Gefangenschaft. Die brennende Legion kann Euch nicht mehr durch die Schreckenslords kontrollieren und Ihr seid nicht l�nger verpflichtet, dem Willen der Legion zu gehorchen. Nun wird niemand die Gei�el daran hindern, ihren wahren Zweck zu erf�llen.

column2: Go back to the Nether, demons!
column4: Zur�ck in den wirbelnden Nether mit euch, D�monen!

column2: You are no longer a pawn of the Legion!\n
column4: Ihr seid nicht l�nger ein Untergebener der Legion!\n

column2: You have completed your assignment. The Legion has begun its burning crusade for Azeroth, but still needs your support. Your undead army can have a major impact on the course of the invasion. If we decide to help the Legion, the mortals will have almost no chance. However, if we decide to betray the Legion, the demons will be dealt with swiftly.
column4: Ihr habt Eure Aufgabe erf�llt. Die Legion hat ihren brennenden Kreuzzug um Azeroth begonnen, ist aber immer noch auf Eure Unterst�tzung angewiesen. Eure Armee aus Untoten kann noch immer einen gewaltigen Einfluss auf den Verlauf der Invasion haben. Wenn wir uns entschlie�en, der Legion zu helfen, haben die erb�rmlichen Sterblichen fast keine Chance. Sollten wir uns dagegen daf�r entscheiden die Legion zu verraten, werden die verdammten D�monen schon bald erledigt sein.
Ich bin der Legion treu ergeben!

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] obeyed our will and will support our cause in the war against the puny mortals of Azeroth. There is no doubt that the people of Azeroth will fall, and we will destroy this cursed planet!
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] hat unserem Willen gehorcht und wird die brennende Legion im Krieg gegen die erb�rmlichen Sterblichen von Azeroth unterst�tzen. Ohne Zweifel werden die V�lker von Azeroth fallen und wir werden diesen erb�rmlichen Planeten zerst�ren!

column2: Damn you, [From.GetFirstName]! [From.GetTitledFirstName] betrayed us. We will destroy the Scourge along with all the races of Azeroth who dare resist the will of the Legion. We will destroy this planet!
column4: Ihr sollt verdammt sein, [From.GetFirstName]! [From.GetTitledFirstName] hat uns verraten. Wir werden die Gei�el wie alle V�lker Azeroths, die sich dem Willen der Legion widersetzen, ausl�schen, und dann diesen erb�rmlichen Planeten zerst�ren!

column2: In recent months, much has happened: the mystical Plague, rumours of the dark cult of necromancers. You finally have a quiet evening to think about everything in retrospect. You feel something... odd. That something ominous is happening and that you are at the center of these events. In this dark hour of Azeroth, your actions could change the course of history, and to save your vassals and citizens from all of the trials and tribulations that await them. You will be unstoppable, and something in your head tells you that some courses of action may not be as righteous as they seem.
column4: Ihr habt schon vieles miterlebt: den Anfang der Seuche, die Infiltration des Kults der Verdammten, und die Invasion der brennenden Legion. Nun, wo all diese Ereignisse hinter Euch liegen, habt Ihr endlich ein paar freie Stunden, um �ber alles nachzudenken. Ihr habt das Gef�hl, dass etwas Unheimliches geschieht, und Ihr Euch im Zentrum dieser Ereignisse befindet. In dieser dunklen Stunde k�nnten Eure Handlungen den Lauf der Geschichte �ndern und Eure Leute vor all den Problemen retten, die auf sie warten. Ihr werdet unaufhaltbar sein, und etwas in Eurem Kopf sagt Euch, dass manche Handlungen nicht so rechtschaffen sein werden, wie sie wirken.

column2: The nightmare continues. The city is disgraced with burned buildings, piles of corpses, and the smell of decaying flesh that lingers from your deceased brothers and sisters. When the plague was in its infancy, you could not imagine it would be this bad. The Scourge is growing and growing with every one of your people that falls. You cannot imagine a worse way to die.
column4: Dieser Albtraum findet kein Ende. Die Stadt ist gesch�ndet durch brennende Geb�ude, Berge von Leichen und den Gestank verfaulenden Fleisches, der von Euren k�rzlich verstorbenen Br�dern und Schwestern stammt. Als die Seuche ihren Anfang fand, konnte sich niemand vorstellen, dass es zu so etwas kommen k�nnte. Die Gei�el w�chst und w�chst mit jedem toten Soldaten und Bauern. Die Seuche schont weder Frauen noch Kinder. Einen schlimmeren Tod k�nnt Ihr Euch nicht vorstellen.

column2: What have they done to my people?
column4: Was haben sie meinem Volk angetan?

column2: The people who have become infected with the plague cannot be saved. Only pain and suffering await them. Once they die, they will become Scourge, and each might take another ten good men with them. If we do not stop this, it will not be long before we all succumb! The only way out is to save the infected from suffering. We must kill them all!
column4: Zweifellos k�nnen die Armen, die sich mit der Pest infizierten, nicht gerettet werden. Sie erwarten nur Schmerz und Leid. Und nach dem Martyrium werden sie zu einem Teil der Gei�el, der ein Dutzend andere Leben mit sich rei�t. Wenn wir dies nicht beenden, werden wir alle bald sterben. Der einzige Ausweg ist, die Infizierten von ihrem Leiden zu erl�sen. Wir k�nnen nicht zulassen, dass sie noch mehr unschuldige Menschen t�ten. Wir m�ssen sie auf der Stelle ausl�schen!

column2: I will save them from their suffering!
column4: Ich werde sie von ihren Qualen erl�sen!

column2: Terrible news has reached your court. The Scourge has driven even the most noble people to carry out atrocious acts... [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] army have killed all of the infected residents of [From.GetName]. Among the infected people were men, women, and children, but [Root.GetFirstName] showed them no mercy. Following the butchering, [Root.GetSheHe] had [Root.GetHerHis] men set the city on fire, leaving it in ruins.
column4: Schreckliche Nachrichten haben Euren Hof erreicht. Die Gei�el bringt die selbst die edelsten Menschen dazu, grausame Dinge zu verrichten...\n[Root.GetTitledFirstName] und [Root.GetHerHis]e Armee haben alle infizierten Einwohner von [From.GetName] abgeschlachtet. Unter ihnen befanden sich M�nner, Frauen und Kinder, aber [Root.GetFirstName] zeigte kein Erbarmen. Nach [Root.GetHerHis]er schrecklichen Tat setzte [Root.GetSheHe] die Stadt in Brand und legte sie in Schutt und Asche.

column2: Word of your deeds has spread far and wide to foreign courts. The Scourge has driven people such as you to carry out atrocious, but necessary, acts... You and your army have killed all of the infected residents of [From.GetName]. Among the infected people were men, women, and even children, but you showed them no mercy. Following the butchering, you had your men set the city on fire, leaving it in ruins to prevent the dead from ever rising again.
column4: Die Nachricht von Euren Taten hat den Hof erreicht. Die Gei�el bringt die Menschen dazu, schreckliche aber notwendig Dinge zu verrichten.\nIhr und Eure Armee habt die infizierten Einwohner von [From.GetName] abgeschlachtet. column3: Je ne peux pas le croire�!

column2: It was the only way out.

The dreadlord [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], who was involved with the Scourge's plague in your kingdom, has fled to Northrend. There's no doubt that the source of the Scourge and its terrible sickness originates from there. If you strike at the heart of the Scourge itself, then you may be able to save your people. Upon returning from this campaign, your countrymen and women will surely greet you as a hero!
column4: Der Schreckenslord [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], der an den Gr�ueltaten der Gei�el in Eurem Heimatland beteiligt war, floh nach Northrend. Es gibt keinen Zweifel mehr, dass die Gei�el von dort kam. Wenn Ihr im Herzen der Gei�el zuschlagt, k�nnt Ihr Euer Volk vielleicht noch retten. Wenn Ihr von dieser Kampagne zur�ckkehrt, werdet Ihr gewiss als Held gefeiert werden.

column2: The cold winds of Northrend assail your face without remorse. There is a strong smell of death and rot lingering in the air, but the scent settled in many decades ago. Somewhere among these frozen wastes, one of the architects of the Scourge hides, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName]. His death would bring you great pleasure after all what the Scourge did to your people. You cannot stop until you find him, and you must seek vengeance for all that you had to endure... for all that you had to do.
column4: Die kalten Winde von Northrend zerschneiden gnadenlos Euer Gesicht. Die Luft stinkt nach jahrzehntealtem Tod und F�ulnis. column2: A few days ago, the ships of a potential champion, [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName], anchored off the shores of the northern continent of Northrend. [target_champion.GetSheHeCap] is distinguished by [target_champion.GetHerHis] arrogance, aspiration, and ambition. You believe that [target_champion.GetSheHe] has all the qualities necessary to become your most loyal and powerful ally. Someday [target_champion.GetSheHe] will move to the dark side of the force. To achieve this, you have hidden a mighty runesword - Frostmourne - in one of the frozen caves of Northrend. If everything goes according to plan, then [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName] will certainly find it...

column2: To your great regret, [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName] did not step in and left Northrend without getting caught by your tricks. column2: Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] traveled to the lands of the cold Northrend along with an army of volunteers. Straight into the heart of the Scourge. Who knows what will happen to [target_champion.GetHerHim] there.

column2: You have been wandering around the icy wastelands of Northrend for quite some time, smashing one undead army after another and destroying all its manifestations on this continent. Your troops are already beyond exhaustion and want to return home. They do not understand that if we do not win against the undead here, there will be nowhere to go back to. You must stop all attempts at desertion! At any cost! The ships on which you sailed must be burnt! Your army will have no choice but to fight here.

column4: Unternehmt nichts. Lasst diese Feiglinge davon laufen!

column2: You are increasingly confronted with innumerable legions of undead. You destroy one undead and it is replaced by five more. column2: So what are we waiting for?!

Your quest led you to an inconspicuous entrance to a cave. As soon as you went inside, you were struck by its size. It was a huge hall with icy walls. In the center was a small platform, upon which lies an altar with a treasured blade. Approaching the blade, you began to feel something dark in it. It is cursed, but there was no doubt in its power. It could change everything... it could save you and your people.

column2:
Terrible news have come to your hall. [Root.GetDynName], driven mad by a runeblade, killed the previous ruler [From.GetTitledFirstName] right in [From.GetHerHis] throne room and usurped power in the state.

column2: Has not used this decision in the last 10 years\n

column2: This morning you were told that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has died. To be more precise, [From.GetSheHe] is no longer among the living. Soon after [From.GetHerHis] death, [From.GetSheHe] was raised into undeath through necromancy.

Nach [From.GetHerHis]em Tod wurde [From.GetSheHe] durch schwarze Magie wiederbelebt und zu einer dieser untoten Kreaturen.

column2: Now we are on the same side.
column4: Nun sind wir auf derselben Seite.

column2: You prepared everything for the long-awaited operation while your prisoner [target_prisoner.GetFirstName] was tied to the surgical table. [target_prisoner.GetFirstName] attempted to break the restraints or at least scream, but it was all in vain. When my servants made the first cuts, the exhausting groans of the victim echoed throughout the operating room, which only ceased when [target_prisoner.GetFirstName] lost [target_prisoner.GetHerHis] consciousness from pain and shock.

column2: I'm stronger than I ever was!

column2: The operation is already a couple of hours through. Your servants were able to open the skull of the prisoner and are already prepared to retrieve the most important part of the body - the brain. You need to decide how to deal with the gray matter. You can remove the higher cognitive functions and make the creature more obedient, but this will greatly affect the thinking abilities.

column2: Pieces of meat do not need to think.
Try to keep the brain intact.

column2: The operation is almost complete. A monster stitched from the parts of bodies of different people lies upon the table, almost ready to be given life. The sight of this creature will disgust many, but you feel inspired! It has the strength and size of all its "donors". Such qualities will be very useful.

Der Anblick dieser Kreatur wird viele abschrecken, aber Ihr f�hlt Inspiration! Es hat die St�rke und Gr��e all seiner �Spender�. Solche Qualit�ten werden sehr hilfreich sein.

Soon, [target_physician.GetSheHe] has a noticeable smile on [target_physician.GetHerHis] face, placing several pins and a set of metal clips onto the wooden surgical table and announcing the long-awaited "Done!" Next on the wooden tables are set of sets of scalpels, metal clips and threads, which your servants laid out before the operation. Now that all the sets of limbs were carefully delivered to the operating room, the surgeon takes a scalpel and makes a series of neat cuts on your body, then beginning to sew new flesh to you.

column2: Piles of flesh and extra limbs adorn your body. The muscles and veins of those poor creatures that have fallen victim to the knives of your servants are now a part of you. The horrendous look of your new form will cast fear and awe into the hearts of your enemies and allies, and your newfound great physical strength will lead you to victory on the battlefield, even when up against the most experienced warriors of Azeroth.

Der schreckliche Anblick Eurer neuen Form wird die Herzen von Feinden und Verb�ndeten vor Angst und Ehrfurcht erstarren lassen und Eure neu gefundene k�rperliche St�rke wird Euch auf dem Schlachtfeld zum Sieg f�hren, selbst gegen die erfahrensten Krieger von ganz Azeroth.

column2: Joins the faction and forms an alliance with every member!\n
column4: Tretet der Fraktion bei und geht ein B�ndnis mit jedem Mitglied ein!\n

column2: Arriving in Azeroth, you noticed that the pale-skinned members of your clan changed in behaviour, and began to behave even stranger than before. They were seized with pure ecstasy! This behavior frightens other clans. They do not obey orders and all the time babble about the Hour of Twilight, the end of the world, which they told you about on Draenor. This is alarming. Is the Hour of Twilight close and will it happen here... on Azeroth?
column4: Als Ihr in Azeroth ankommt, bemerkt Ihr, dass die hellh�utigen Mitglieder Eures Clans ihr Verhalten ver�ndern und sich noch merkw�rdiger als zuvor verhalten. Sie sind von purer Ekstase ergriffen! Dieses Verhalten macht den anderen Clans Angst. Sie gehorchen keinen Befehlen und murmeln die ganze Zeit �ber von der Stunde des Zwielichts, dem Ende der Welt, von dem sie Euch bereits auf Draenor erz�hlt hatten. Das ist beunruhigend. Ist die Stunde der D�mmerung nahe und wird hier... auf Azeroth geschehen?

column2: I have to find out what's going on.
column4: Ich muss herausfinden, was da vor sich geht.

column2: As soon as the first stars began to light up in the sky of Azeroth, you collected all the pale-skinned of your clan at the big fire. You shouted at them absolutely any threats, but they only looked indifferently at you with dark-clouded eyes. "The Hour of Twilight is near. We hear their voice and you, [Root.GetFirstName], do not change anything anymore", they almost chorus. Feeling your helplessness, you realized that with them it seems all is over. Nothing prevents you from giving your leader an order to exterminate them.

Wir h�ren Ihre Stimme und Ihr, [Root.GetFirstName], k�nnt nichts daran �ndern� erklingen sie fast gleichzeitig. Mit Schrecken wird Euch Eure Machtlosigkeit klar. Nichts hindert Euch mehr daran, Eurem Marschall den Befehl zu geben, sie hinzurichten.

column2: As soon as the first stars began to light up in the sky of Azeroth, you collected all the pale-skinned of your clan from a large clan fire. They told you that the Hour of Twilight is already very close and it will really happen on this planet. About this, pale-skinned told you about some creatures of the abyss, the Old Gods, who were locked up by the Titans in magical prisons deep beneath the earth's crust of this world. This is very strange to you, but it's all very similar to the truth. If the Old Gods and the Void really exist, then who are we to protest their will?
column4: Kaum dass die ersten Sterne den Himmel Azeroths zu leuchten begannen, versammelt Ihr alle hellh�utigen Mitglieder Eures Clans am gro�en Lagerfeuer. Sie verk�nden Euch, dass die Stunde des Zwielichts bereits sehr nah ist und dass es in dieser Welt geschehen wird. Von einigen der Gesch�pfe der Leere, den alten G�ttern, die von den Titanen in magischen Gef�ngnissen tief unter der Erdkruste eingekerkert wurden, erz�hlen sie Euch. Das erscheint Euch sehr seltsam, aber es scheint der Wahrheit sehr nahe zu kommen. Wenn die alten G�tter und die Leere wirklich existieren, wer sind wir uns Ihrem Willen entgegenzustellen?

column2: I will take care of it!

Now you too begin to hear the whispers of the Old Gods. They tell you of the Hour of Twilight, about the Titans, the giant creatures that crushed the Black Empire, and then locked the Old Gods in the very bowels of Azeroth, and about the Void with its incredible power. Now it all makes sense. Every decision in your life has led you to this point, to the Old Gods. You must write down everything that the Old ones whisper to you. A couple of days spent in a quiet room, and you can record all the sermons of your new masters. A book written on the skin of the most faithful cultists, who were madly ready to sacrifice their flesh, will become the beacon of a new faith, and you will become its great prophet!
column4: Seit kurzem k�nnt auch Ihr das Fl�stern der alten G�tter vernehmen. Sie erz�hlten Euch von der Stunde des Zwielichts, von den Titanen, den gewaltigen Kreaturen, die das Schwarze Imperium zermalmt und dann die alten G�tter in Azeroths Innerem eingesperrt hatten, und �ber die Leere und ihre unglaubliche Macht. Nun ergab alles einen Sinn. Jede Entscheidung in Eurem Leben f�hrte Euch zu diesem Moment, zu den alten G�ttern. Ihr m�sst alles aufschreiben, was die Alten Euch zufl�stern. Ein paar Tage in einem ruhigen Raum, und Ihr k�nnt alle Predigten Eurer neuen Meister niederschreiben. Ein Buch, das auf der Haut der treuesten Kultisten geschrieben wurde, die in ihrem Wahn bereit waren, ihr Fleisch zu opfern, wird zum Leuchtfeuer des neuen Glaubens und Ihr werdet ihr gro�er Prophet!

column2: Hear the voice of the Old Gods!

column2: The Cult of the Twilight's Hammer was created to serve the Void and powerful creatures called the Old Gods. The cultists unconditionally fulfil the will of their lords, bringing the Hour of Twilight closer - the final hour, when traces of life will be snuffed out and the universe will plunge into darkness.

Kultisten gehorchen bedingungslos dem Willen ihrer Meister und bringen die Stunde des Zwielichts n�her - die Schicksalsstunde, in der alle Spuren des Lebens verschwinden und das Universum in Dunkelheit versinkt.

column2: The Voice from Beyond the Sea
column4: Die Stimme von jenseits des Meeres

column2: The Hour of Twilight is approaching! The Old Gods decided that you will play one of the key roles. The voice of one of the Old Gods, called C'Thun, calls you to his prison, located on a mysterious continent to the west of here. Your cult must fulfil its mission in relieving the Old Gods from the bonds that the Titans created. Sail west, in search of a continent called Kalimdor, there you will meet your destiny!

column2: Your ship has landed at the lifeless sandy shore of a new continent. The area around was dark and gloomy, everything around spoke about the presence of the Old God. As soon as you stepped on the sand of southern Kalimdor, you felt that something was swarming under your feet. From this feeling, you were distracted by the whisper of C'Thun who ordered you to continue your journey further, straight to the ruins of temple structures, whose towers could be seen far ahead, blurring in the hot air of a dead desert.

column2: This desert was far from lifeless. Under the sand and in the air, billions of huge insects, the creations of C'Thun, were swarming. They were enthusiastic about the imminent awakening of their lord. As we approached the huge temple city, their numbers increased. It was under these ruins that the Old God slept. Now your place is here, beside his prison, waiting for the hour when C'Thun will call you.
column4: Diese W�ste war alles andere als leblos. Unter dem Sand und in der Luft schw�rmten Milliarden von riesigen Insekten, Sch�pfungen C'Thuns, die vom bevorstehenden Erwachen ihres Meisters begeistert waren. column2: I'll spread its will across Kalimdor!

column3: Le Culte du Marteau du Cr�puscule

column2: There are rumours that a new cult has appeared in Azeroth. They call themselves the Cult of the Twilight's Hammer and serve strange ancient creatures that sleep, imprisoned in magical dungeons, deep underground and in the oceans. There is little information about the goals of the Twilight's Hammer cultists, but if you believe those few who are unfortunate enough to encounter them, these fanatics and their Lords are waiting for a certain Hour of Twilight, the end of the world, when the whole universe is plunged into eternal darkness.
column4: Es wird gemunkelt, dass in Azeroth ein neuer Kult aufgetaucht ist. Sie nennen sich Kult des Schattenhammers und dienen seltsamen, uralten Wesen, die in magischen Verliesen tief unter der Erde und in den Ozeanen schlafen. �ber die Ziele der Schattenhammer-Kultisten ist wenig bekannt, aber wenn Ihr den wenigen glaubt, die das Gl�ck hatten, eine Begegnung mit diesen Fanatikern zu �berleben, warten diese und ihre Meister auf die so genannte Stunde des Zwielichts, das Ende der Welt, wenn das gesamte Universum in die ewige Dunkelheit st�rzt.

column2: The master's shadow will cover the world!

column2: Attempt to find out whether �Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]�! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a member of the Twilight's Hammer Cult.

column2: The Old Gods and the Void have bestowed upon you the last blessing. Your body, disorted by numerous mutations under the influence of the Void, has retained only the barely noticeable outlines of your former race. Giant tumors, creepy outgrowths of the body, slimy tentacles... littered your body, turning you into the creation of the deepest abyss of Azeroth, into a creature of nightmares in the service of the Old Gods.

The expedition passed through a fairly large hall with massive granite pillars supporting a huge stone arch. Numerous precious utensils are scattered throughout this room. Golden cups, silver plates and spoons and some other incomprehensible cutlery just lies on the floor. Without a doubt, this is the very treasury we've been looking for. Now that we're done collecting the trophies, we can go to the surface.

column2: Despite all the obstacles, the expedition was able to get to the great artifact. Here it is - the Eye of Sargeras, the great demonic artifact is right here, at arm's length. The magical flows that emanate from it are incredible, they almost push everyone from where they are standing, drowning out the voice of reason. The expedition no longer has any doubts, there is only a desire - a desire to absorb a part of the strength of the Fallen Titan.
column4: Trotz aller Hindernisse gelang es der Expedition, das m�chtige Artefakt zu erlangen. Hier ist es - das Auge von Sargeras, ein gro�es d�monisches Artefakt, direkt vor Eurer Nase. Die magischen Str�mungen, die von ihm ausgehen, sind unglaublich, sie sto�en fast jeden weg und �bert�nen die Stimme der Vernunft. Die Expedition hat keine Zweifel mehr, es gibt nur einen Wunsch - den Wunsch, einen Teil der Macht des gefallenen Titan zu absorbieren.

column2: I've been waiting for this for so long...
column4: Ich habe schon so lange gewartet...

column2: In recent days you have faced terrible nightmares, where you were alone in absolute darkness. Out of the darkness, the voices whisper something to you, showing you images of a strange world. The terrifying landscapes are impossible to forget, particularly the obelisks of the temple-city where ashes fill the air and lava lines the streets. In the distance, you can see grotesque towers looming over the landscape� and an eldritch presence weighing down on you. You can feel His gaze upon you. Reality is meaningless to you now, and only the dream remains.
column4: In letzter Zeit begannen schreckliche Albtr�ume Euch des Nachts heimzusuchen. In diesen Tr�umen wart Ihr allein in absoluter Dunkelheit. \nAus dieser Dunkelheit heraus fl�sterten Stimmen Euch etwas zu und zeigten Euch Bilder einer fremden Welt. Ihr erinnertet Euch deutlich an diese erschreckenden Landschaften: Ein steiniges Relief, �bers�t mit Lavastr�men, Asche in der hei�en Luft  und in der Ferne sind die grotesken Obelisken der Tempelstadt zu erkennen und... Ihr sp�rt eine unheimliche Pr�senz auf Euch. Die Wirklichkeit ist jetzt bedeutungslos, nur der Traum bleibt.

column2: The air in your lungs is beginning to give way. Only a dim ray of light from the surface is giving you the hope to continue swimming upwards from the deep water. Deep down, though, you always knew that there was no hope. After all, He would never allow you to escape, for you are nothing but His prey. Something tightly grabs your leg and pulls you down into the abyss. You try to resist, but He only squeezes your leg tighter, to the point of breaking your bone. You scream in agony, but there is no one to hear your cries here, far beneath the surface. He drags you deeper and deeper until the thin ray of light from the surface completely vanishes. There is no light for you, no hope. In this realm, He reigns supreme, and you are an insect before Him.
column4: Die Luft in Euren Lungen war beinahe aufgebraucht. Nur ein schwacher Lichtstrahl von der Oberfl�che gab Euch Hoffnung, noch auftauchen zu k�nnen... aber tief im Innern wusstet Ihr, dass alles hoffen vergebens gab... Er w�rde Euch nicht davonkommen lassen. Er will Euch. Etwas umschlingt Euer Bein und zieht Euch in den Abgrund. Ihr versucht zu widerstehen, aber Er quetscht Euren Fu� nur fester und zerbricht die Knochen. Ihr schreit vor Schmerz, aber niemand h�rt Euer St�hnen unter Wasser. Er zieht Euch tiefer und tiefer, bis der Lichtstrahl von der Oberfl�che vollst�ndig verschwunden war. Hier unten gibt es kein Licht, keine Hoffnung. Hier in Seinem Reich gibt es nur Euch und Ihn.

column2: There is nowhere to run. As the seconds pass, breathing becomes more difficult, with the ashes of the burning forest settling in your lungs. There is nowhere to hide, no where you can escape from Him. Powerless, you fall into into the half-rotten foliage, alongside all the other corpses. Now, when escape has become meaningless, it almost feels like the stench of this place has become even stronger. Silence pervades the air, only interrupted by the sound of your heart� and a melodic voice in your head. You can hide from Him, but He will always be with you here... in your dreams... in your thoughts... until the grim moment you resign yourself to your fate.
column4: Ihr k�nnt nirgendwo hin entkommen. Mit jedem Atemzug setzt sich mehr Asche eines verbrannten Waldes in Euren Lungen fest. Ihr k�nnt Euch nicht vor Ihm verstecken. Ersch�pft fallt Ihr in halb verrotteten Bl�ttern zusammen, neben all den Leichen. Jetzt, wo jeder Gedanke an Flucht sinnlos geworden ist, scheint es Euch, dass der Gestank dieses Ortes noch st�rker geworden ist. Es herrscht eine durchdringende Stille, die nur durch Euren Herzschlag und... eine melodische Stimme in Eurem Kopf unterbrochen wird. Ihr k�nnt Euch vor Ihm verstecken, aber Er wird immer hier bei Euch sein... in Euren Tr�umen... in Euren Gedanken... bis zu dem d�steren Moment, in dem Ihr Euch mit dem Schicksal abfinden m�sst.

column2: You press up against the frozen stone column, hoping against hope that It does not notice you. The abomination slowly enters the spacious hall with its loud footsteps ringing out in the air. And then... silence. Your body is shaking from your wounds and the cold, but you know that to make a single sound would be your death sentence. And then, the monster�s voice mockingly echoes through the room, "I hear the beating of your heart." Suddenly, the column you are hiding behind is shattered into a million pieces, one of which falls on your hand, breaking the bone. The monster straightens, before raising a gigantic foot above your head.

column2: You hold the dagger in your hands, lifting it above the bound girl. She looks at you for a moment, with tears streaming down her cheeks. For a moment you freeze in shock. What are you even doing here? In the middle of the enormous hall, disfigured people surround a stone altar. They chant dark words in an unrecognizable language, all the while swaying from side to side. Where are you? Who are these people? You try to remember how you got here, but the last few hours are hazy, and nothing seems to make sense. You begin to shake, your grip weakening, before the dagger starts to slip out of your hands. But then, a voice cuts through your mind. �Do it!� He says, and you are powerless to deny him
column4: Ihr haltet den Dolch in den H�nden und hebt ihn �ber das gefesselte M�dchen. Es sieht Euch an, Tr�nen rinnen �ber seine Wangen. F�r einen Moment erstarrt Ihr im Schock. Was machst Ihr hier �berhaupt? In einer riesigen dunklen Halle mit steinernem Altar in der Mitte. Von Tumoren entstellte Menschen dr�ngen sich um ihn. column2: The Nightmares have not visited you in some time. However, the painful visions of the Void and the eldritch city still scar your memory, impossible to forget. They were so detailed, so... real. Sometimes you really were teetering on the verge of life and death, at the very edge of insanity. But now everything is over. And whatever it is, whatever you saw in those dreams, you hope that they have left you permanently, never to plague your sleep again. However, deep in your soul, you can still feel His eyes upon you.

column2: The dreams have blurred the lines of reality, to the point you can no longer discern the difference between your waking and dreaming hours. There is something more powerful than you out there, something more powerful than any mortal in this world, locked away in its weakened state. They want revenge for Their imprisonment, and they wish to bring death upon the world. You see Them in your dreams, just as you saw Their underground dungeons. They showed you the prophecy - what They desire you to turn Azeroth into by the end of your life. And just as you saw the prophecy foretelling the end of the world, you saw your destiny. They want you to usher in a dark age upon Azeroth. You must fulfil the will of the Old Gods!

Slowly, the great beast rises with its back erect, shying its eyes away from the brightness of the sun. It raises one of its giant claws to meet the sky, and with one stroke wipes out most of the awe-inspired crowd, throwing them back several meters like small children. Those who survived the creature's initial wrath made no effort to escape as they stood completely frozen in utter fear.

column2: The Rebirth of the Black Empire

The ancient evil has awakened in the depths of Azeroth. The evil, which was defeated by the Titans thousands years ago, has risen once again. The ancient dark civilization, the Black Empire, has reborn again. Thousands of faithful followers of the Old Gods, led by one leader, have gathered under its twilight banners. Unified as never before, they are chanting the names of their dark lords and proclaiming the beginning of the end. Could this be the beginning of the Hour of Twilight?

column2: Single, but so different. Trying to achieve the same goal, but in different ways. Your thoughts are drowned in their whispers, but among them there is the loudest... the most sonorous and sweet for your hearing.

column2: This character is a follower of C'Thun. C'Thun is the ancient god of chaos, imprisoned in Ahn'Qiraj. Under his influence, a part of the aqirs, born from the living matter of the ancient gods, became a race of qiraji. About a thousand years ago, the expedition of the night elf druids disturbed the peace of his prison, because of which the ancient god awakened the armies of his faithful vassals and their servants, the silithids, and sent them to the elves. The confrontation was completed only with the help of bronze dragons, which sealed Ahn'Qiraj with a magic barrier. Although C'Thun is still locked in his temple city, the magic walls do not stop the whispers of the ancient god to reach to the farthest corners of Azeroth.
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein Anh�nger C'Thuns. C�Thun ist der alte Gott des Chaos, eingesperrt in Ahn'Qiraj. Unter seinem Einfluss wurde ein Teil der Akir, die aus der lebendigen Materie der alten G�tter geboren wurden, zur Rasse der Qiraji. Vor etwa tausend Jahren st�rte eine Expedition von Nachtelfen-Druiden den Frieden seines Gef�ngnisses, aufgrund dessen der uralte Gott die Heerscharen seiner treuen Leibeigenen und ihrer Diener, der Silithiden, erweckte und sie gegen die Elfen aussandte. Die Konfrontation wurde nur mit Hilfe der Bronzedrachen beigelegt, die Ahn'Qiraj mit einer magischen Barriere versiegelten. Obwohl C'Thun immer noch in seiner Tempelstadt eingeschlossen ist, stoppen die magischen Mauern nicht das Fl�stern des alten Gottes, das bis in die �u�ersten Winkel von Azeroth reicht.

column3: Yogg-Saron... le Dieu de la Mort�!

column2: This character is a follower of Yogg-Saron. Yogg-Saron is the ancient god of death, imprisoned beneath Ulduar. Under his influence, a part of the aqirs, born of the living matter of the ancient gods, became the race of nerubians. It is Yogg-Saron who had the honour of creating many races of Azeroth - manipulating his custodian Loken, he managed to impose on the will of the will, the machine for creating the titanides, the Curse of the Flesh, because of which, over time, all the new titanides became flesh, and then began transmitting the disease to the rest the creation of the titans. It was the god of death that sent the Nightmare's seeds to the Emerald Dream, thereby initiating the Emerald Nightmare. Manipulating the custodian Loken, he also managed to disable the remaining jailors of Ulduar. Now Yogg-Saron is considering a further escape plan, calling for the release of his servants from all over Azeroth.
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein Anh�nger Yogg-Sarons. Yogg-Saron ist der alte Gott des Todes, der Tief unter Ulduar eingesperrt ist. Unter seinem Einfluss wurde ein Teil der Akir, die aus der lebendigen Materie der alten G�tter geboren wurden, zur Rasse der Neruber. Es war Yogg-Saronauf den die Erschaffung vieler Rassen von Azeroth zur�ckgeht - durch Manipulation seines W�rters Loken gelang es ihm, der Schmiede des Willens, einer Maschine zur Herstellung von Titaniden, den Fluch des Fleisches aufzuzwingen, der im Laufe der Zeit alle neuen Titaniden Fleisch sterblich werden lie� und begann dann, die Krankheit auf den Rest der Kreaturen der Titanen zu �bertragen. Es war auch der Todesgott, der die Samen des Alptraums in den smaragdgr�nen Traum sandte und damit den smaragdgr�nen Albtraum ausl�ste. Durch die Manipulation des W�chters Loken gelang es ihm auch, den Rest der Gef�ngnisw�rter Ulduars au�er Gefecht zu setzen. column2: Y'Shaarj... the God of Seven Heads!

column2: This character is a follower of Y'Shaarj. Y'Shaarj is the ancient God of Seven Heads, killed by titan pantheon. Under his influence, a part of the aqirs, born from the living matter of the ancient gods, became the race known as the mantid. Y'Shaarj was the strongest ancient god and it was him that the titans first fought. But, by ripping him out from Azeroth, the pantheon caused irreparable damage to the whole world. Y'Shaarj's tentacles had for a long time penetrated into the very depths of Azeroth. After his death, his last breath manifested as the Sha, the dark energy that permeated the continent of Pandaria, where his heart is hidden, whose dark pulse does not cease to beat in the minds of his devoted servants.
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein Anh�nger Y'Shaarjs. Y'Shaarj ist der alte Gott der sieben K�pfe, der vom Pantheon der Titanen get�tet wurde. Unter seinem Einfluss wurde ein Teil der Akir, die aus der lebendigen Materie der alten G�tter geboren wurden, zur Rasse der Mantiden. Y'Shaarj war der st�rkste der alten G�tter und der erste, den die Titanen bek�mpften. Als das Pantheon ihn aus Azeroth herausriss, f�gten sie der ganzen Welt damit einen irreparablen Schaden zu, da die Tentakeln von Y'Shaarj schon vor langer Zeit die Tiefen Azeroths durchdrungen hatten. Nach dem Tod verwandelte sich sein Atem in Sha, eine dunkle Energie, die das Land des Kontinents Pandaria durchdrang, wo sein Herz verborgen liegt. Dessen dunkler Puls h�rt nicht auf, in den K�pfen seiner treuen Diener zu schlagen.

column2: N'Zoth... the God of the Deep!

This character is a follower of N'Zoth. N'Zoth is the ancient god of the depths, imprisoned at the bottom of the Great Sea. Being the weakest of the ancient gods, he, however, had no less destructive influence on the world than his brothers. The god of the depths is responsible for the expansion of the Emerald Nightmare generated by Yogg-Saron � he is guilty of clouding the mind of Neltharion, the aspect of the black dragons and his further destruction. In addition, it is assumed that it was he who created the race of the naga when the night elves of Azshara drowned after the Great Sundering. Whatever waters surround his prison, N'Zoth's whisper still pierces the minds of his servants on the surface.
column4: Dieser Charakter ist ein Anh�nger von N'Zoths. N'Zoth ist der alte Gott der Tiefen, eingekerkert am Grund des Gro�en Meeres. Obwohl er der schw�chste der alten G�tter ist, �bte er doch einen ebenso zerst�rerischen Einfluss auf die Welt wie seine Br�der. Der Gott der Tiefen ist f�r die Ausdehnung des smaragdgr�nen Albtraums, der von Yogg-Saron geschaffen wurde, verantwortlich - er ist schuld an der Tr�bung von Neltharions Geist, dem Aspekt der schwarzen Drachen, und seiner weiteren Zerst�rung. Au�erdem wird angenommen, dass er es war, der Rasse der Naga aus denjenigen Nachtelfen Azshara geschaffen hat, die mit Azshara nach der Spaltung ertranken. Unbeeindruckt davon, wie viel Wasser sein Gef�ngnis umgibt, erreicht das Fl�stern von N'Zoth noch immer die Gedanken seiner Diener an der Oberfl�che.

column2: Difficult times have come to your lands. The threat of defeat in the war is significant. It could turn into an absolute disaster! It's not the first night you spend in your library thinking about it. Turning over the next page of the dusty book, you stumble upon something that could save your country: knowledge of violent wolf-like creatures from the world of dreams, called worgen, and how to open a portal to their world. Their strength and ferocity can be used against your enemies. This is your chance!

column2: Once everything was prepared for the ritual, you started the opening of the portal. In the first moments, the room was filled with a green mist. You have felt an unusually soothing scent of the forest, which inspires a deep sense of peace. But it did not last long... you noticed yellow eyes staring out of the darkness on that side of the portal. Soon other yellow lights began to light up in the darkness of the world of dreams. They felt thirst for freedom and revenge, burning fury, ready to kill everyone who gets on the arm. Only a glance at these glowing eyes is enough to understand that the worgen can not be controlled. But it was already too late...
column4: Nachdem alles f�r das Ritual vorbereitet war, habt Ihr mit der �ffnung des Portals begonnen. In den Anfangsmomenten war der Raum mit einem gr�nen Nebel gef�llt. Ihr sp�rtet einen ungew�hnlich beruhigenden Duft des Waldes, der ein tiefes Gef�hl des Friedens vermittelt. Aber es dauerte nicht lange... Ihr bemerktet gelbe Augen, die aus der Dunkelheit auf der anderen Seite des Portals starren. Bald begannen andere gelbe Lichter in der Dunkelheit der Traumwelt zu leuchten. Sie hatten Durst nach Freiheit und Rache, brennende Wut, bereit, jeden zu t�ten, der sich in Reichweite befindet. Nur ein Blick auf diese leuchtenden Augen gen�gt, um zu verstehen, dass die Worgen nicht kontrolliert werden k�nnen. Aber es war schon zu sp�t...

Their animal rage was too much to try and contain, and so they began to attack both [Root.GetHerHis] enemies and allies! Those who were bitten by these creatures have started to transform into Worgen as well.

column2: He appeared out of nowhere. He jumped on you from the shadows, gnawing at your arm with his fangs. A few moments later he ran away. It has been hours after the bite, and your mind has completely plunged into the abyss of bestial rage. Now you are one of them... one of the worgen.
column4: Er erschien aus dem Nichts. Er sprang aus den Schatten auf Euch zu und bohrte seine Rei�z�hne in Euren Arm. Wenige Augenblicke sp�ter lief er weg. Es sind schon Stunden seit dem Biss vergangen, und Euer Verstand ist g�nzlich in den Abgrund der tierischen Wut versunken. Jetzt seid Ihr einer von ihnen.... einer der Worgen.

column2: This morning you have found out that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] was bitten by a wild worgen. In a couple of hours, the curse completely took possession of [From.GetHerHis] mind.
column4: Heute Morgen habt Ihr herausgefunden, dass [From.GetEuerEure] [GetFromRelation][From.GetFirstName] von einem wilden Worgen gebissen wurde. In ein paar Stunden nahm der Fluch den [From.GetHerHis]en Geist vollst�ndig in Besitz.

column2: You have read many books from the libraries of Azeroth and not for the first dozen times practiced your magic. The knowledge and experience you gained made you stronger than before.

column2: Behind your shoulders is not the first dozen fights, in which you actively trained the skills of possession of weapons and honed the tactics of combat. The knowledge and experience you gained made you stronger than before.

column2: The animal has completely taken over your mind. Together you went with your pack deep into the forests of Azeroth, forever saying goodbye to normal life.

column2: Dull fires in the forest more often loom before your eyes. You smell them... the smell of prey! Having crept closer, you see two peasants. They are hastily trying to find at least a small track of the road from the forest. Easy prey!

column4: Egal, ich werde sie in Ruhe lassen.

column2: When he stopped breathing, you looked at the second victim. He stood in shock, sending a torch on you. Does he hope to scare you off? Stupid and weak creatures. His fate is already decided.

column2: You quietly crept up in the tall grass on the children, and then with a rapid leap you grabbed one child and began to drag it into the woods by the scruff. The screams of other children flooded the clearing, in the village they began to sound the alarm, but that would not save the child.

Die Schreie anderer Kinder �berfluteten die Lichtung, im Dorf begannen sie, Alarm zu schlagen, aber das w�rde das Kind nicht retten.

column2: Before your eyes, a small ravine was opened in the center of your grove. The smell brought you here... You do not see anything, but you feel that they are hiding somewhere here. These creatures hold you for a stupid animal: they set up traps with meat and wait until you get caught. Presumptuous prey!
column4: Vor Euren Augen wurde ein kleiner Hohlweg in der Mitte Eures Geh�lzes ge�ffnet. Der Geruch hat Euch hierher gebracht... column2: Sometimes, through the gusts of animal fury, you hear the voice of reason. What have you become? Feelings of deep guilt tear you from inside, turns inside out. At such times, you are overwhelmed by a desire to return everything as it was... to regain your past life.

Zu diesen Zeiten seid Ihr �berw�ltigt vom Wunsch, alles wiederherzustellen, wie es war... um Euer fr�heres Leben zur�ckzugewinnen.

column2: In search of another way, you have found a way to drain mana from absolutely any source of magic. It can be both objects and beings. In addition, arcane magic was not the only way to fulfil your hunger. There are many other more powerful forces that would help alleviate your pain.

column2: Like other magical creatures, demons are a source of powerful magic. However, the connection to the Twisting Nether and the colossal amount of Fel energy in these creations is striking. Their energy can be used to quench the growing hunger of your people, but it can have consequences.

Ihre Energie kann genutzt werden, um den wachsenden Hunger Eures Volkes zu stillen, aber das kann Konsequenzen haben.

column2: The Void is the source of a pristine, infinitely powerful and very dangerous energy. The beings of the Void are cruel and ruthless. One has only to cross the line and will be in the hands of these terrible creatures. However, if you can control the magic of the Void, you can satisfy the hunger of all your people.

Sobald diese Grenze �berschritten ist, befindet man sich in den H�nden dieser schrecklichen Kreaturen. Wenn Ihr aber die Magie der Leere kontrollieren k�nnt, k�nnt Ihr den Hunger all Eurer Leute stillen.

column2: We will never sink so low!

column2: It's been a long time since those events, and here you are again at home. As predicted by the Lord, the Plague and wars have ruined these lands. The mortals were too presumptuous and could not resist the onslaught of the Scourge. Now, on their bones the new order shall be built.
column4: Es ist lange her, dass diese Ereignisse stattgefunden haben, und nun seid Ihr wieder zu Hause. Wie vom Meister vorhergesagt, haben die Seuche und die Kriege dieses Land zerst�rt. Die Sterblichen waren zu anma�end und konnten dem Ansturm der Gei�el nicht widerstehen. Nun soll auf ihren Knochen die neue Ordnung aufgebaut werden.

column3: La Restauration du Puits de soleil

column2: The day the powers of the Sunwell disappeared was one of the darkest tragedies in the history of the elves. You could not even imagine how the elves were so dependent on the secret magic of its waters. The magical famine claimed tens of thousands of lives, but all of them did not die in vain. The well will be restored - at any cost. And you will do anything to prevent this from happening ever again.
column4: Der Tag, an dem die Kr�fte des Sonnenbrunnens verschwanden, war eine der d�stersten Trag�dien in der Geschichte der Elfen. Es war unvorstellbar, wie sehr die Elfen von der geheimnisvollen Magie seines Wassers abh�ngig waren. Die magische Hungersnot forderte Zehntausende von Leben, aber nicht alle starben umsonst. Der Brunnen wird restauriert - um jeden Preis. Und Ihr werdet alles tun, um zu verhindern, dass dies jemals wieder geschieht.

column2: You can no longer continue the restoration of the Sunwell.
column4: Ihr k�nnt die Erneuerung des Sonnenbrunnens nicht l�nger fortsetzen.

column2: After the destruction of the Well, you have long thought about the magical dependence of the elves. You saw how brothers and sisters fought against each other to death for mana crystals and other petty sources of mana. No doubt, the Sunwell and the secret magic let you down! Sooner or later, it had to happen. Well, if this secret magic can not help the elves then you know another way.

Ihr habt gesehen, wie Br�der und Schwestern bis zum Tod gegeneinander k�mpften, um Manakristalle und andere kleine Manaquellen zu bekommen. Kein Zweifel, der Sonnenbrunnen und die geheime Magie haben Euch im Stich gelassen! Fr�her oder sp�ter musste es passieren. Nun, wenn diese geheime Magie den Elfen nicht helfen kann, dann wisst Ihr einen anderen Weg.

column2: No, I don't want that fate for the elves.

column2: After the destruction of the Sunwell, not all its powers were lost irrevocably. There are rumours that the remnants of its energy were hidden in the body of a young girl. It is the key to its recovery. If you can find it, then the elves have a chance to return the sacred source to former glory.
column4: Nach der Zerst�rung des Sonnenbrunnens gingen nicht all seine Kr�fte unwiderruflich verloren. Es gibt Ger�chte, dass die �berreste seiner Energie im K�rper eines jungen M�dchens versteckt waren. Es ist der Schl�ssel zu seiner Wiederherstellung. Wenn Ihr es finden k�nnt, dann verf�gen die Elfen �ber ein Mittel, die heilige Quelle wieder in ihren fr�heren Glanz zu versetzen.

column2: At long last, the great wizards of Quel'Thalas found her - a girl with golden hair. She is the only remaining vessel of the Sunwell's energy. And more precisely, it is the pure energy of the Sunwell, which has acquired the form of human. She is your chance to restore the Sunwell! You must save her life at all cost!
column4: Endlich haben die gro�en Zauberer von Quel'Thalas es gefunden - ein M�dchen mit goldenen Haaren. Sie ist das einzige verbliebene Gef�� der Energie des Sonnenbrunnens. Ihr m�sst sein Leben um jeden Preis retten!

The streams of the Void energy from beyond the boundaries of our reality rushed to the plateau, filling the holy place of the elves with the magic of darkness. With the power of the Void, the power of the new Sunwell will surpass its predecessor.

column2: Many different clans gathered here to sacrifice and appease the spirits and elements of Azeroth. All of them watched tremendously at the beginning of the ceremony.

column2: During one of the ceremonies, for no particular reason, [target_murderer.GetFirstName] publicly stabbed [target_victim.GetFirstName] with a dagger into the chest [target_victim.GetSheHeCap] fell to the ground with the crowd only mocking the weakling and soon after dispersed.

column2: I will not let them down.

After one of the ceremonies, you were invited to a feast, which is conducted by the most notable births. Entering under the inconspicuous linen canopy, you saw mountains of various dishes. The feast is in full swing.
column4: Nach einer der Zeremonien wurdet Ihr zu einem Festmahl eingeladen, das f�r die bedeutendsten Neugeborenen ausgerichtet wird. Als Ihr unter das unscheinbare Leinendach tretet, seht Ihr Berge von verschiedenen Gerichten. Das Fest ist bereits in vollem Gange.

column2: The Blade of the Black Empire

Your servants informed you that a humpbacked wrinkled old man arrived at your court. He offers you his gift: an elegant black runic blade with a handle adorned with an ominous eye. If you accept his gift, the elder promises not to disturb you any more. Although the old man does not look like a credible person, but... this blade really beckons you with its aura of antiquity and mystery. It can become an excellent trophy in your treasury.
column4: Eure Diener informierten Euch, dass ein buckliger, runzliger alter Mann an Eurem Hof ankam. Er bietet Euch sein Geschenk: eine elegante schwarze Runenklinge mit einem Griff, der mit einem unheilvollen Auge verziert ist. Wenn Ihr sein Geschenk annehmt, verspricht der �lteste, Euch nicht mehr zu st�ren. Auch wenn der Alte nicht glaubw�rdig erscheint... diese Klinge lockt mit ihrer Aura von Altertum und Geheimnis. Sie kann eine ausgezeichnete Troph�e in Eurer Schatzkammer werden.

column2: This is Xal'atath! Give it to me!
column4: Das ist Xal'atath! Gebt es mir, SOFORT!

column2: After you took the ritual blade from the old man, you have begun to hear voices. During the last few days, you have faced countless nightmares, which were silenced by the gentle whispers of Xal'atath, when it was in your possession. Have you lost your mind? Or is this blade cursed and trying to speak to you? The blade beckons you!
column4: Nachdem Ihr die Ritualklinge von dem geheimnisvollen Alten empfangen hattet, fingt Ihr an, Stimmen zu h�ren. W�hrend der wenigen Tage, die sie bisher in Euren H�nden war, hattet Ihr unaufh�rlich Alptr�ume, die durch das sanfte Fl�stern von Xal'atath unterbrochen wurden. Habt Ihr den Verstand verloren? Oder ist diese Klinge verflucht und versucht, mit Euch zu sprechen? Die Klinge ruft nach Euch!

column2: Last night, you secretly crept into the treasury, guided by the whispers of Xal'atath. Once you were inside, the black blade told you of Azeroth�s darkest secrets: in the farthest corners of this world, a true madness lives, an eldritch horror of the distant past. In ancient times, Xal'atath shed seas of blood in the name of dark elders... but now, these times have passed. Your determination has entertained Xal'atath, and she is willing to guide you... for now.
column4: Eines Nachts schlicht Ihr Euch, geleitet vom Fl�stern Xal'ataths, heimlich in die Schatzkammer. Dort erz�hlte Euch die schwarze Klinge von Hunderten dunkler Geheimnisse Azeroths: In den entlegensten Ecken dieser Welt herrscht der reinste Wahnsinn, ein erstgeborenes �bel. In alten Zeiten vergoss Xal'atath f�r dieses �bel Meere von Blut... aber jetzt sind diese Zeiten vorbei... Eure Entschlossenheit am�siert Xal'atath, sie ist bereit, Euch zu f�hren... vorerst.

column2: Xal'atath is a creation of the Void itself. Born of the darkness, she knows many secrets about the Void and its inhabitants. The Void is one of the fundamental forces in the universe, existing even before the cosmos itself, and it is far more than a mere tool to be wielded at the whims of mortals. Your conversations with Xal'atath sometimes last for hours, and you have learned much from it, but your knowledge is still agonizingly small compared to the knowledge that the black blade possesses.
column4: Xal'atath ist eine Sch�pfung der Leere selbst. Geboren aus der Dunkelheit, kennt sie viele Geheimnisse �ber die Schatten und ihre Kreaturen. Die Leere ist eine der fundamentalen Kr�fte im Universum, eine seiner Grundlagen, aber man sollte nicht denken, dass sie nur ein Instrument in Euren H�nden ist... Manchmal w�hren Eure Gespr�che mit Xal'atath viele Stunden, aber Euer Wissen ist immer noch unvergleichlich klein im Vergleich zu ihrem.

column4: Xal'atath, erz�hlt mir von den alten G�ttern.

column2: The battlefield in [GetName.target_province] has been cloaked in darkness. After the first surge of Void energy rushed from the black blade, the darkness that it summoned laid waste to every soldier in its path, all of whom died in excruciating agony. Even as the darkness fades, the sight of countless corpses mutilated with the energy of the Void instills terror in all those who were fortunate to survive it.
