Als die erste Welle der Leerenenergie aus der Klinge des schwarzen Imperiums hervorbrach, starb jeder, der auf dem Weg der Dunkelheit war, in qualvoller Pein. Ihre Schreie und dunklen verst�mmelten Leichen sch�rten Angst in denjenigen, die das Gl�ck hatten, es zu �berleben.

column2: Last night, you discovered that an ancient ritual blade has disappeared from your treasury. No one saw the thieves, even though the treasury is heavily guarded day and night. It almost seems to have disappeared into thin air... but you can still hear the echoes of its sinister laughter.
column4: Ihr habt entdeckt, dass eine alte rituelle Klinge aus Eurer Schatzkammer verschwunden ist. Niemand sah die Diebe, obwohl sie Tag und Nacht bewacht wurde. Sie scheint sich in Luft aufgel�st zu haben... aber man h�rt immer noch das Echo ihres unheimlichen Lachens.

column2: Suddenly, you feel an invisible force grabbing you by the throat. The sinister voice of Xal'atath rings in your head. "I am afraid your use to me has come to an end. It was a mistake to trust me, you know." With every second that passes, it is getting harder to breathe... the last sound you hear before the darkness takes you is the laughter of the treacherous black blade.
column4: Pl�tzlich sp�rtet Ihr, dass eine unsichtbare Kraft Euch an der Kehle packte. Das finstere Lachen von Xal'atath klang in Eurem Kopf: �Ihr seid zu schwach geworden!� Mit jedem Atemzug wird es schwieriger... die Dunkelheit verzehrt Euch.

column2: When you learned about Medivh's death, you almost lost all hope of gaining immortality, when suddenly this strange map got into your hands. It shows the possible location of the Broken Isles. A large red blot on it marked a certain structure. Can this be the Tomb of Sargeras? Anyway, you have no other choice.
column4: Als Ihr von Medivhs Tod erfahrt, habt Ihr fast die Hoffnung auf Unsterblichkeit aufgegeben, als Euch pl�tzlich diese seltsame Karte in die H�nde fiel. Es zeigt die m�gliche Lage der zerbrochenen Inseln. Ein gro�er roter Fleck darauf markierte eine gewisse Konstellation. Kann dies das Grabmal von Sargeras sein? Wie dem auch sei, Ihr habt keine andere Wahl.

column2: There were many rumours behind your back. Those who knew you very closely, clearly noticed a change in you, but did not give it more importance. How wrong they have been! But now everyone knows what you did. There is no more meaning to hide your true intentions.
column4: Es gab viele Ger�chte hinter Eurem R�cken. Diejenigen, die Euch genau kannten, bemerkten deutlich eine Ver�nderung in Euch, haben Ihr aber nicht mehr Beachtung geschenkt. Wie sehr sie sich geirrt haben! Aber jetzt wei� jeder, was Ihr getan habt. Es ergibt keinen Sinn mehr, Eure wahren Absichten zu verbergen.

column2: You're losing the war. Your troops suffered many defeats and let the enemy into your lands. These cowards are not even able to protect their kingdom, what can we say about the seizure of Khaz Modan! Your last hope of winning is to find another weapon against the hostile clans. The power of the elements that sleeps under this place can draw enemy troops into the ashes! They will still see the power of the Dark Iron Clan!
column4: Ihr seid dabei, den Krieg zu verlieren. Eure Truppen erlitten viele Niederlagen und lie�en den Feind in Euer Land. Diese Feiglinge sind nicht einmal in der Lage, ihr K�nigreich zu sch�tzen, wie sollen wir da die Besetzung von Khaz Modan planen? Eure letzte Hoffnung zu gewinnen ist, eine andere Waffe gegen die feindlichen Clans zu finden. Die Macht der Elemente, die unter diesem Ort schlummern, kann feindliche Truppen in Asche verwandeln! Sie werden noch die Macht des Dunkeleisen-Clans kennenlernen!

column2: We will do without the help of magic!
column4: Wir k�nnen dies ohne die Hilfe der Magier schaffen!

column2: For the ritual you gathered the best mages of your clan. When you were casting the spell, you used all your fury, all your hatred to crush your enemies. All your losses and defeats flashed before your eyes, and giant fiery whirlwinds burst from the center of the ritual circle, instantly turning into ashes all summoners and charring your skin. The outlines of a giant elemental began to emerge from this fiery chaos. The heat radiating from it slowly tore the flesh from your bones, bringing unthinkable pain�
column4: F�r das Ritual habt Ihr die besten Magier Eures Clans versammelt. Als Ihr den Zauber wirktet, habt Ihr all Eure Wut, all Euren Hass benutzt, um Eure Feinde zu vernichten. All Eure Verluste und Niederlagen blitzten vor Euren Augen auf, und riesige Feuerwirbel brachen aus der Mitte des rituellen Kreises hervor, verwandelten die Beschw�rer sofort in Asche und verkohlten Eure Haut. Die Umrisse eines riesigen Elementars begannen aus diesem feurigen Chaos aufzusteigen. Die Hitze, die von ihr ausgeht, riss langsam das Fleisch von Euren Knochen und brachte unvorstellbare Schmerzen...

column2: Ashes, which escaped with a stream of lava from the newly formed volcano, covered most of the Redridge Mountains. The heat, charred the skin of those who were nearby, and burned most of the buildings to ashes. The fiery chaos under the gaze of the fire lord Ragnaros swept the Redridge Mountains. His faithful lieutenants and legions of elementals raged in the vastness of Azeroth for a long time, subordinating local creatures to their will and turning these lands into a scorched desert.
column4: Die Asche, die mit einem Lavastrom aus dem neu entstandenen Vulkan entwich, bedeckte den gr��ten Teil der Rotkamm-Berge. Die Hitze verkohlte die Haut derer, die in der N�he waren, und verbrannte die meisten Geb�ude zu Asche. Das feurige Chaos unter dem Blick des Feuerlords Ragnaros fegte durch das Rotkamm-Gebirge. Seine treuen Leutnants und Legionen von Elementaren w�teten lange Zeit in der Weite Azeroths, unterwarfen die einheimischen Gesch�pfe ihrem Willen und verwandelten diese L�nder in eine verbrannte W�ste.

column2: You went to the place of offering to the elements. Noble, poor, homeless - you all go shoulder to shoulder to the sacrificial altar. You all are trifles for eternally raging elements. Stepping forward to the altar, you prepared to make your sacrifice�

column2: My life belongs to the lord!

The elementals accepted your sacrifice. You, kneeling before the viceroy of the Lord, were endowed with a blessing. Use it to spread His will into the furthest corners of Azeroth - and remember, the elements always watch over you.
column4: Die Elementargeister nahmen Euer Opfer an. Ihr, der Ihr vor dem Stellvertreter des Meisters kniet, wurdet mit einem Segen bedacht. Benutzt ihn, um seinen Willen in die entferntesten Ecken Azeroths zu tragen - und denkt daran, dass die Elemente immer �ber Euch wachen.

column2: Traveling across Azeroth, from the corner of your eye you noticed a dull glint on the ground. It was a large black sphere, covered with a handful of loose soil. Sun glints on it were barely noticeable, as if almost all the light was absorbed by this mysterious object. You felt darkness radiating from it. But somewhere in the depths of this blackness you sensed something, light - like it was trapped inside the crystal.

Aber irgendwo in den Tiefen dieser Schw�rze war etwas zu sp�ren, Licht - als w�re es im Kristall eingeschlossen.

column2: As soon as you touched the crystal, the darkness quickly crept up your arm. To your joy, thanks to the reaction, you managed to pull it off, but your limb was struck to the elbow. Strong burning pain tied it, but soon went on recession. Although you did not lose your hand, it was extremely weakened, the skin turned black, and the pain is still tormenting you. As for the crystal...

Obwohl Ihr Eure Hand nicht verloren habt, wurde sie extrem geschw�cht, die Haut verf�rbte sich schwarz, und der Schmerz qu�lt Euch immer noch. Was den Kristall betrifft...

column2: I need to be careful with it.

You have always felt the small presence of light in that black crystal, which is stored in your treasure chest. In these dark days, your hope that it can become the most powerful weapon in the fight against evil has grown stronger. You have already noticed how this sphere absorbs the light... Is it possible that you can purify the crystal? In any case, you do not have many choices.
column4: Ihr habt immer die winzige Pr�senz des Lichts in diesem schwarzen Kristall gesp�rt, der in Eurer Schatzkiste aufbewahrt wird. Ihr habt bereits bemerkt, wie diese Kugel das Licht absorbiert... Ist es m�glich, dass lhr den Kristall reinigen k�nnt? Auf jeden Fall habt Ihr keine gro�e Auswahl.

column2: Along with other priests and paladins, you began to transfer the energy of the Light into the crystal. Absorbing the magic it began to shine dimly. Slowly but surely the sphere was filled with the Light. When you were finished, the radiance of the once dark crystal blinded your sight, the streams of light enveloped the whole room. You have never felt such a strong presence of the Light, as it warmed your skin with its gentle embrace.
column4: Zusammen mit anderen Priestern und Paladinen habt Ihr begonnen, die Energie des Lichts auf den Kristall zu �bertragen. Er absorbierte die Magie und begann schwach zu leuchten. Langsam aber sicher wurde die Kugel mit dem Licht gef�llt. Als ihr fertig wart, blendete die Ausstrahlung des einst dunklen Kristalls euren Blick, die Lichtstr�me durchdrangen den ganzen Raum. Ihr habt noch nie eine so starke Pr�senz des Lichts gesp�rt, wie es eure Haut mit seiner sanften Umarmung erw�rmt hat.

To you it seemed like it took forever. Finally, when the doors swung open, the smiths appeared before you with a shining blade, a halo of holy, cleansing flames surrounding it. As soon as you took hold of the sword, you felt the power of the Light within the sword and with it you could bring down the forces of evil.

Kaum dass Ihr das Schwert ergriffen habt, sp�rtet Ihr die Kraft des Lichts im Schwert, und mit ihm k�nntet Ihr die Kr�fte des B�sen niederstrecken.

Many were captured and enslaved, others wandered around the world in search of temporary asylum. It was not the life that your ancestors desired, but there is still hope! In a dream, a vision of a mysterious prophet came to you. He said that to the west of these lands lies another continent - Kalimdor. There, the orcs will find their own destiny!

Strange snakelike creatures, along with murlocs, assaulted the island, killing and snatching all the living creatures.

column2: After a long voyage across the Great Sea, the red flags of the Horde flew off the eastern shores of Kalimdor. In short time, orcs and their new allies built the first fortifications on the uninhabited land of the mainland. Having lost their homeland and all hope of a quiet life, many of them were already calling this place their new homeland. But only time will tell what fate awaits them here.

column2: The Frostwolf Clan, ruled the by honourable orc [Root.GetTitledFirstName] have found their new home in [Root.Capital.GetName]. They have chosen independence from the Horde, and seek to secure the future of their clan by creating a new homeland for their tribe. This has led some clans to label the Frostwolves as traitors, though the Frostwolves counter that those clans in the Horde are traitors to their old ideals and traditions. It remains to be seen just how this new development will impact the other clans. Maybe more will choose tradition over unity?

Sie haben sich f�r die Unabh�ngigkeit von der Horde entschieden und versuchen, die Zukunft ihres Clans zu sichern, indem sie eine neue Heimat f�r sich schaffen. Dies hat einige Clans dazu veranlasst, die Frostw�lfe als Verr�ter zu bezeichnen, obwohl die Frostw�lfe entgegenhalten, dass die Clans in der Horde Verr�ter ihrer alten Ideale und Traditionen sind. Es bleibt abzuwarten, wie sich diese neue Entwicklung auf die anderen Clans auswirken wird. Vielleicht werden mehr die Tradition �ber die Einheit stellen?

column2: Durotan, son of Garad and father of Go'el, is the chieftain of the Frostwolf Clan. Relations between the Frostwolf and the Blackrock clans were icy, even before the invasion of Azeroth, due to the Frostwolves refusing to accept the demonic bargain and drink the blood of Mannoroth. When the Horde crossed over into Azeroth, Durotan continued to voice opposition regarding the Horde's leadership, which caused Gul'dan to exile the Frostwolf Clan.

column2: The Long Road to the North

column2: With this new beginning, we have chosen ideals and tradition over unity and bloodshed. It is the first step down a road to an uncertain future, one that may bring glory, prosperity, and security, or maybe death and suffering. Regardless of what lies ahead, you are certain that this is a road that must be travelled, for what lies behind you is a fate that your people cannot bear.\n\nHeading north, we have found an inhospitable land of snow and mountains. This will not do. [root.GetTitledFirstName], where do we go from here?

Sans aucune consid�ration pour ce que vous laissez derri�re vous, vous �tes certains que c'est cette route l� qui doit �tre emprunt�e, car vous abandonnez un autre destin que votre peuple ne peut supporter. En allant vers le nord, nous sommes tomb�s sur une terre inhospitali�re, froide et montagneuse. Ce n'est pas notre destination. [root.GetTitledFirstName], o� allons nous d�sormais ?

Das wird nicht reichen. [root.GetTitledFirstName], wie geht es weiter?

column2: You continue on, journeying through the mountains until they drop almost directly into the sea. This may not be a good place to settle, but you realize you have two choices. Should we consider going back and settle in the mountain valley, or look for a way over the water, [Root.GetTitle]?

column4: Ihr zieht nach S�den und lasst euch im Alteractal nieder.

column2: After scouting the coastline, we have found a small, poorly-protected port with lots of merchant ships docked in it. Commandeering the ships would be very easy.
column4: Nachdem wir die K�stenlinie erkundet haben, entdeckten wir einen kleinen, schlecht gesch�tzten Hafen, in dem viele Handelsschiffe vor Anker lagen. Die Schiffe zu kapern, w�re sehr einfach.

column2: A messenger arrived with dire news. A small trading port in northern Lordaeron was raided, and the ships stolen by bandits! Worse yet, no one seems to know exactly who the bandits were.
column4: Ein Bote �berbrachte uns schreckliche Nachrichten. Ein kleiner Handelshafen im Norden Lordaerons wurde �berfallen und die Schiffe von Banditen gestohlen! Schlimmer noch, niemand scheint genau zu wissen, wer die Banditen waren.

column2: Those damn murlocs must be getting smarter...
column4: Diese verdammten Murlocs werden wohl schlauer...

column2: My [Root.GetTitle]! We managed to steal the ships without loss among our clan! Now we can sail north, putting both land and water between us and the Horde!
column4: Mein [Root.GetTitle]! Wir haben es geschafft, die Schiffe ohne Verluste in unserem Clan zu stehlen! Jetzt k�nnen wir nach Norden segeln und Land und Wasser zwischen uns und der Horde bringen!

column2: While out on the sea, we ended up sailing directly into a horrible storm. Many of our tribesmen died, and more yet are missing. You decide to turn and sail away from it, taking what's left of the Frostwolves and returning south. However, the current carries you far to the west of where you were, to a chain of islands known as the Dragon Isles. You make the hard decision to settle here, wondering if there was better land for you beyond the sea.
column4: Als wir auf dem Meer waren, segelten wir direkt in einen schrecklichen Sturm. Viele unserer Stammesangeh�rigen starben, und noch mehr werden vermisst. Ihr beschlie�t, umzudrehen und von ihm wegzufahren und das, was von den Frostw�lfen �brig ist, zu nehmen und nach S�den zur�ckzukehren. Die Str�mung f�hrt euch jedoch weiter westlich von dort, wo ihr aufgebrochen seid, zu einer Kette von Inseln, die als Dracheninseln bekannt sind. Ihr trefft die schwere Entscheidung, euch hier niederzulassen und fragt Euch, ob es f�r euch besseres Land jenseits des Meeres gibt.

column2: After that we can capture the local castle...
column4: Danach k�nnen wir die �rtliche Festung erobern...

column2: My [Root.GetTitle]! Land, on the horizon!\nWe ground our boats on a new land, full of giants and animals, untouched by and maybe even unknown to the civilized races of Azeroth. We should settle here!
column4: Mein [Root.GetTitle]! Land, am Horizont!\nWir landen unsere Boote auf einem neuen Land voller Riesen und wilden Tieren, unber�hrt und vielleicht sogar unbekannt f�r die zivilisierten Rassen von Azeroth. Wir sollten uns hier niederlassen!

column2: My [Root.GetTitle], our clan is ready to leave. We've harnessed the wolves, collected our belongings, the women have dressed the children and the men have sharpened their axes. Is it time to go?
column4: Mein [Root.GetTitle], unser Clan ist bereit zu gehen. Wir haben die W�lfe gez�gelt, unser Hab und Gut eingesammelt, die Frauen haben die Kinder gekleidet und die M�nner haben ihre �xte gesch�rft. Ist es Zeit zu gehen?

column2: This may have been a mistake. With every step, the weather seems to get hotter, the animals larger and nastier, and the plants stranger. It must get better at some point, right?
column4: Das k�nnte ein Fehler gewesen sein. Mit jedem Schritt scheint das Klima hei�er zu werden, die Tiere gr��er und b�ser und die Pflanzen fremder. Es muss irgendwann besser werden, oder?

column2: No one ever said this would be easy!
column4: Niemand hat je gesagt, dass es einfach werden w�rde!

column2: It's hard to hunt on an empty stomach, especially with the wildlife here being so vicious and aggressive. Even the plants and berries seem to fight back, their poisons sapping the strength from us, making us throw up the little food we manage to find. There are several options for us, none of which seem easy...
column4: Es ist schwer, auf n�chternen Magen zu jagen, besonders wenn die Tierwelt hier so b�sartig und aggressiv ist. Sogar die Pflanzen und Beeren scheinen sich zu wehren, ihre Gifte entziehen uns die Kraft und zwingen uns, die wenigen Lebensmittel, die wir finden, wegzuwerfen. Es gibt mehrere Optionen f�r uns, von denen keine einfach erscheint...

column2: We try to ignore the hunger. Starvation sets in, making our men weak, our women frail, and our children howling with need. We can't keep going like this!
column4: Wir versuchen, den Hunger zu ignorieren. Das Verhungern setzt ein und macht unsere M�nner schwach, unsere Frauen gebrechlich und unsere Kinder heulen vor Not. Wir k�nnen nicht so weitermachen!

column2: At least we are not dead...

Alchemy and herbalism are not Frostwolf traditions, but desperate times call for desperate measures. We have sent some of our men and women to search for edible plants and berries. It may not be in line with our ideals, and it certainly would be dangerous, but what good are ideals and traditions when you're dead?
column4: Alchemie und Kr�uterkunde sind keine Traditionen der Frostw�lfe, aber verzweifelte Zeiten erfordern verzweifelte Ma�nahmen. Wir haben einige unserer M�nner und Frauen ausgeschickt, um nach essbaren Pflanzen und Beeren zu suchen. Es mag nicht im Einklang mit unseren Idealen stehen, und es w�re sicherlich gef�hrlich, aber was n�tzen Ideale und Traditionen, wenn man tot ist?

column2: You find enough plants to feed your people.
column4: Ihr findet gen�gend Pflanzen, um eure Leute zu ern�hren.

column2: You find plants, but they're poisonous. Again.
column4: Ihr findet Pflanzen, aber sie sind giftig. Schon wieder.

column2: You find plants, but not enough to keep the clan fed.
column4: Ihr findet Pflanzen, aber nicht genug, um den Clan zu versorgen.

column2: Success! Our foragers have found enough edible plants to feed our people. We can continue on!
column4: Erfolg! Unsere Sammler haben gen�gend essbare Pflanzen gefunden, um unsere Bev�lkerung zu ern�hren. Wir k�nnen weiterziehen!

column2: Our elders will talk of this day for ages to come!
column4: Unsere �ltesten werden noch lange �ber diesen Tag sprechen!

column2: We found edible plants, or so we thought. Within a few hours, the clan's stomachs began grumbling for a different reason...
column4: Wir fanden essbare Pflanzen, oder so dachten wir wenigstens. Innerhalb weniger Stunden begannen die M�gen des Clans aus einem anderen Grund zu murren...

column2: I hope we have enough latrines!
column4: Ich hoffe, wir haben genug Latrinen!
Das Essen hat Euch krank gemacht!

column2: Our foragers have returned, saying they couldn't find anything edible.
column4: Unsere Sammler sind zur�ckgekehrt und berichten, dass sie nichts Essbares finden konnten.

column2: As dangerous as the animals here can be, we have decided that hunting them is the only way to survive.
column4: So gef�hrlich die Tiere hier auch sein m�gen, wir haben beschlossen, dass die Jagd auf sie der einzige Weg zum �berleben ist.
Schickt ein paar M�nner zur Jagd.

column2: Our men have returned with carcasses over their shoulders and wide smiles on their faces. The hunt was a success! We have enough to feed our clan.
column4: Unsere M�nner sind mit Kadavern auf den Schultern und einem breiten L�cheln auf dem Gesicht zur�ckgekehrt. Die Jagd war ein Erfolg! Wir haben genug, um unseren Clan zu ern�hren.

column2: It was my decision to leave in the name of our traditions, and my people have suffered for my decision. As their leader, it is my duty to care for them and uphold our ways, so I have decided to lead the hunt
column4: Es war meine Entscheidung, im Namen unserer Traditionen zu gehen, und mein Volk hat f�r meine Entscheidung gelitten. Als ihr Anf�hrer ist es meine Pflicht, f�r sie zu sorgen und unsere Lebensweise zu wahren. Deshalb habe ich mich entschieden, die Jagd zu leiten.

column2: You find enough game to feed your people.
column4: Ihr findet genug Wild, um euer Volk zu ern�hren.

column2: Lok'tar! We have bested this inhospitable land, and I lead the hunting party home with enough wildfowl to feed the whole of my people.
column4: Lok'tar! Wir haben dieses unwirtliche Land besiegt, und ich f�hre die Jagdgesellschaft mit gen�gend Wildgefl�gel nach Hause, um meinen Clan zu ern�hren.

column2: I have failed my people. I return home with nothing more than a wounded body and wounded pride. My people, though sad and disappointed, at least respect my attempt to provide for them.
column4: Ich habe mein Volk entt�uscht. Ich komme mit nichts anderem als einem verwundeten K�rper und verwundetem Stolz nach Hause zur�ck. Mein Volk ist zwar traurig und entt�uscht, respektiert aber zumindest meinen Versuch, f�r sie zu sorgen.

column2: My [Root.GetTitle]! Our scouts have returned, giving us two choices. Nearby is an area that could be settled, though going further south would give us access to the sea.
column4: Mein [Root.GetTitle]! Unsere Sp�her sind zur�ckgekehrt und bieten uns zwei M�glichkeiten. In der N�he befindet sich ein Gebiet, das besiedelt werden k�nnte, obwohl eine Weiterfahrt nach S�den uns Zugang zum Meer verschaffen w�rde.

column2: You move closer to the sea.

We decided to stay in the Black Morass for a while and look for allies. It might not be the wisest idea, since Gul'dan has been encouraging the other orcs to turn against us, but it's still worth the effort.
column4: Wir beschlossen, eine Weile im Black Morass zu bleiben und nach Verb�ndeten zu suchen. Es ist vielleicht nicht die kl�gste Idee, da Gul'dan die anderen Orks ermutigt hat, sich gegen uns zu wenden, aber es ist immer noch die M�he wert.

column2: The other orcs are talking about Durotan spreading dissension among the Horde, hoping other clans will leave with him.
column4: Die anderen Orks sprechen davon, dass Durotan Zwietracht unter der Horde verbreitet und hofft, dass andere Clans mit ihm gehen werden.

column2: They are weak and not worth our time. Whatever they do, they cannot achieve anything.
column4: Sie sind schwach und unserer Zeit nicht wert. Was auch immer sie tun, sie k�nnen nichts erreichen.

column2: It seems like no matter what we try, [From.GetFirstName]'s words weigh heavier than ours, and the other orcs view us as either fools or traitors. At the very least, my clan respects my attempts to get the other orcs to see things our way.
column4: Es scheint, dass, egal was wir versuchen,[From.GetFirstName]s Worte schwerer wiegen als unsere, und die anderen Orks sehen uns entweder als Narren oder Verr�ter an. Zumindest respektiert mein Clan meine Versuche, die anderen Orks dazu zu bringen, die Dinge auf unsere Weise zu sehen.

column2: You decide to leave without the other clans.
column4: Ihr beschlie�t, ohne die anderen Clans zu gehen.

column2: Our words fall on deaf ears. The other orcs won't listen to anything we have to say. We'll just have to leave without them.
column4: Unsere Worte sto�en auf taube Ohren. Die anderen Orks werden auf nichts h�ren, was wir zu sagen haben. Wir m�ssen einfach ohne sie gehen.

column2: Deathwing was one of the five Dragon Aspects. However, driven mad by the Old Gods, he turned against the other Aspects during the War of the Ancients.
column3: Aile de mort, fut l'un des cinq Aspects prot�geant Azeroth. Malheureusement, rendu fou par les Dieux tr�s anciens, il se retourna contre ses fr�res durant la Guerre des Anciens.
column4: Todesschwinge war einer der f�nf Drachenaspekte. Doch von den alten G�ttern in den Wahnsinn getrieben, wandte er sich w�hrend des Krieges der Ahnen gegen die anderen Aspekte.

column2: Lord Alexei Barov is the Lord of the ancient keep of Caer Darrow, possibly the oldest human monument in the world. The Barov family is a wealthy and prestigious dynasty, controlling vast holdings across Lordaeron. However, greed has consumed the family and they are no longer content with their great wealth. Secretly, the House of Barov has made a pact with the Cult of the Damned, and the ancient stronghold of Caer Darrow has become the Cult�s headquarters. Lord Barov has become corrupted by the Cult�s promises and is secretly planning to betray Lordaeron in exchange for eternal life as undead. Can Lord Barov be redeemed by the Light, or will he continue his dread course and serve the Lich King at the cost of his Kingdom?
column4: Lord Alexej Barov ist der Herr der alten Festung von Caer Darrow, m�glicherweise das �lteste menschliche Monument der Welt. Die Barov-Familie ist eine wohlhabende und angesehene Dynastie, die riesige Besitzt�mer in ganz Lordaeron kontrolliert. Die Familie wird jedoch von Gier verzehrt und gibt sich nicht mehr mit ihrem gro�en Reichtum zufrieden. Insgeheim hat das Haus Barov einen Pakt mit dem Kult der Verdammten geschlossen und Caer Darrow ist zum Hauptsitz des Kultes geworden. Lord Barov ist durch die Versprechungen des Kultes korrumpiert worden und plant insgeheim, Lordaeron im Tausch gegen ewiges Leben als Untoter zu verraten. Kann Lord Barov vom Licht erl�st werden, oder wird er seinen schrecklichen Kurs fortsetzen und dem Lichk�nig auf Kosten seines K�nigreichs dienen?

column2: King Thoras Trollbane rules the kingdom of Stromgarde, the successor state of the Arathi Empire with a firm hand. He is a renowned warrior and patriot, having led Stromgarde's army in multiple battles against the Alteraci. A close friend and ally of King Terenas of Lordaeron, Thoras is likely to support Lordaeron in any negotiation that is not outright damaging to his nation's interests. In contrast, however, his relationship with King Aiden Pernolde of Alterac leaves much to be desired, and Thoras would be likely to seize any chance to weaken his rival. Given the strategic position of Stromgarde and its proud martial traditions, it is all but certain that King Thoras will have a key role to play in any future conflicts.
column4: K�nig Thoras Trollbane ist der gro�e Kriegerk�nig von Stromgarde. Urspr�nglich f�hrte er Stromgarde zu einem der Gr�ndungsmitglieder der Allianz von Lordaeron, aber aufgrund von Meinungsverschiedenheiten mit K�nig Terenas zog Thoras Trollbane die Mitgliedschaft von Stromgarde zur�ck. Diese Gegens�tze hinderten Stromgarde jedoch nicht daran, im zweiten Krieg ein heroischer Akteur zu werden. Trollbane f�hrte seine Truppen pers�nlich dazu, die Horde in Alterac abzuschneiden und verhinderte, dass sie die Hauptstadt Lordaeron �berw�ltigten, obwohl ein Gro�teil von Stromgarde in Ruinen lag.

column2: King Llane Wrynn of Stormwind spent his childhood years in the company of two figures that would later become very influential and close friends, the Guardian Medivh and the Lion of Azeroth Anduin Lothar. Llane fought in the wars against the Gurubashi, where his father fell on the field of battle, however, even with the loss of their King, the humans were victorious. Ten years ago, Prince Varian Wrynn was born, the only child and heir of Llane and his Queen, Taria. Under Llane's rule, his Kingdom has prospered, despite Medivh's relentless prophecies of inevitable doom. Recently, scouts have reported news of an alien race coming out through a portal. They have managed to conquer much of the Black Morass with ease, and are even now marching on Stormwind. While their purpose is unknown, it seems war has once again come to Stormwind.
column4: K�nig Llane Wrynn von Stormwind verbrachte seine Kindheit in der Gesellschaft von zwei Pers�nlichkeiten, die sp�ter sehr einflussreiche und enge Freunde werden sollten, dem W�chter Medivh und Anduin Lothar, dem L�wen von Azeroth. Llane k�mpfte in den Kriegen gegen die Gurubashi, in denen sein Vater fiel, doch trotz dieses Verlusts sollten die Menschen obsiegen. Vor zehn Jahren wurde Prinz Varian geboren, das einzige Kind und Erbe von Llane und seiner K�nigin Taria. Unter Llanes Herrschaft ist sein K�nigreich Medivhs unheilvollen Prophezeiungen zum Trotz gediehen. K�rzlich berichteten Sp�her von einer fremden Rasse, die durch ein Portal nach Azeroth gelangt ist. Sie marschieren in diesem Augenblick auf Stormwind zu. Ihr Ziel ist zwar unbekannt, aber es scheint, Stormwind wird wieder einmal von Krieg bedroht.

column2: It's time to stop this carnage. The Horde has conquered enough land to start a new life in Azeroth. Many orcs are returning to their families, burying their axes into the ground. column2: �GWorld Tree�! and �GHolding Slots�! will be added in 3 years\n

In the past few months, it has been difficult not to notice the gigantic branches of the world tree stretching towards the sky and across the horizon. The precious seed planted in [target_province.GetName] has, after several long months, grown to enormous proportions. Its mighty crown shelters several peaceful settlements that hug its trunk and roots that of which create large ripples and hills in the surrounding earth. The nascent world tree looks nigh indestructible, but that is far from the truth. The great tree requires protection from those who would dare threaten it, and the duty falls upon those willing to defend the ideals of life itself.

Seine m�chtige Krone beherbergt mehrere friedliche Siedlungen, die seinen Stamm und seine Wurzeln umarmen, die gro�e Wellen und H�gel in der umgebenden Erde erzeugen. Der im Entstehen begriffene Weltenbaum sieht nahezu unzerst�rbar aus, aber das ist bei weitem nicht die Wahrheit. Der gro�e Baum braucht Schutz vor denen, die es wagen w�rden, ihn zu bedrohen, und die Pflicht f�llt denen zu, die bereit sind, die Ideale des Lebens selbst zu verteidigen.

column2: The lingering presence of the Old Gods in [target_province.GetName] has left an irreparable scar. Life has departed the surrounding groves, and the dark magic of the Emerald Nightmare has come to take its place. The mighty tree has thrown off its foliage, leaving only mutilated black branches behind. Bloodied forests sprout at the trunk and roots of the great tree filled with monsters and altars erected in the name of the Old Gods. Deathly silence lies still over the grove, occasionally disrupted by the soft whispers of the dark ones below. This place has been lost to corruption, and now only fire can truly cleanse this scar from the earth.

Der m�chtige Baum hat sein Laub abgeworfen und nur verst�mmelte schwarze �ste hinterlassen. Dieser Ort ist der Korruption zum Opfer gefallen, und jetzt kann nur noch das Feuer diese Narbe wirklich von der Erde reinigen.

column2: Even at night, the brightest floods of light fill the woods of [target_province.GetName]. The fire of a burning world tree fills the sky like the sun, rising far over the horizon of the highest peaks. Buildings constructed under the roots of the tree have collapsed like a house of flimsy cards under the weight of falling branches. The fire has consumed the tree, nearby settlements, and the nearby forests. There are no words in your tongue that can describe the stench and horror of the destruction wrought by this arson.

column2: After the fall of Nordrassil, the night elves lost their immortality. The blessing from the Aspect of Time, the bronze dragon Nozdormu, has disappeared, confronting the elves with the hardships of mortal life. Outbreaks of disease took many elven lives, mostly children and old people, who remembered the times of the War of the Ancients. All that remains for the elves is to adapt to the harsh conditions of their new mortality.
column4: Nach dem Fall von Nordrassil verloren die Nachtelfen ihre Unsterblichkeit. Der Segen des Aspekts der Zeit, des Bronzedrachens Nozdormu, ist verschwunden und konfrontiert die Elfen mit den Strapazen des sterblichen Lebens. Ausbr�che von Krankheiten forderten viele Elfenleben, vor allem Kinder und Alte, die sich noch an die Zeit des Krieges der Ahnen erinnerten. Alles, was den Elfen bleibt, ist, sich an die harten Bedingungen ihrer neuen Sterblichkeit anzupassen.

column2: In the far reaches of the west, a falling star has crashed upon the relatively peaceful island of Azuremyst. Several pieces and chunks of crystal from the celestial body have scattered across the island chain, contaminating the local ecosystem. We have learned that this crashed object is no simple meteoric rock, but rather a dimensional ship carrying a host of humanoids departed from the shattered world of Draenor, the birthplace of the Horde. These people call themselves the draenei, a race of Light-wielding priests, mages and artificers. They eerily resemble the demonic eredar, who once invaded this world among the Legion's forces. They have crash landed here on Azeroth in an attempt to escape the Legion's onslaught with the help of a being apparently made of pure light, O'ros. Even now, the draenei work to craft a new home for themselves here on Azeroth, centered around the crashed dimensional ship, to which they refer to as the Exodar.

Wir haben erfahren, dass dieses abgest�rzte Objekt kein einfaches Meteorgestein ist, sondern ein dimensionales Schiff mit einer Vielzahl von Humanoiden, die von der zerbrochenen Welt Draenor, dem Geburtsort der Horde, gestartet sind. Diese Leute nennen sich selbst die Draenei, ein Volk von lichtgeweihten Priestern, Magiern und K�nstlern. Sie sind hier auf Azeroth gelandet, um dem Ansturm der Legion mit Hilfe eines Wesens aus reinem Licht zu entkommen. Schon jetzt arbeiten die Draenei daran, sich hier auf Azeroth eine neue Heimat zu schaffen, in deren Mittelpunkt das abgest�rzte Dimensionsschiff Exodar steht.

column2: Having left the eastern kingdoms during the turmoil, the human settlers of Theramore have been quick to adapt to their new home on the continent of Kalimdor. The intermingling of various human cultures in the young kingdom has led to the formation of a new united identity for those who were simply pioneers and refugees before. Now more than ever, Theramore continues to develop into a legitimate human fiefdom not unlike the Seven Kingdoms of old.

column2: The orcish settlement of Kalimdor has brought all the orcish clans of the Horde together within the nation known as Durotar. For many years, the members of these clans have coexisted with each other in an united effort to develop their new homeland in Kalimdor. As a result, the orcish people have risen beyond the old divisions brought wrought by tribal clan hierarchies and customs and have bonded together to form a new identity for all of orc-kind on Azeroth.
column4: Die orkische Siedlung in Kalimdor hat alle orkischen Clans der Horde in der Nation Durotar vereinigt. Seit vielen Jahren koexistieren die Mitglieder dieser Clans in dem gemeinsamen Bestreben, ihre neue Heimat in Kalimdor zu entwickeln. Als Folge davon ist das orkische Volk �ber die alten Spaltungen, die durch Clan-Hierarchien der St�mme und Br�uche entstanden sind, hinausgewachsen und hat sich zu einer neuen Identit�t f�r die gesamte orkische Bev�lkerung Azeroths zusammengeschlossen.

column2: Not many humans would dare to venture into such dangerous corner of the world as the Southern Kalimdor. Those who did found their daily lives a constant struggle to survive. However, after years of living in these dangerous lands, they managed to adapt and prosper, usually by resorting to shady practices. The commonality they shared became much more than one of necessity. These humans became known as the Wastewanders, the menace of the southern sands.

Die Gemeinsamkeiten, die sie teilten, wurden mehr als nur eine Notwendigkeit. Diese Menschen wurden als die �W�stenl�ufer�, die Bedrohung des s�dlichen Sandes, bekannt.

But there's also a group of those who were searching for a new home deep in the wild frontiers of a strange new land, slowly fostering an identity of their own as they look to the future away from the human kingdoms of old.

column2: Relations within [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are stronger than ever. In the wake of newfound internal peace, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] spoke to highranking members and nobles of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. During the private meeting, [Root.GetSheHe] proposed combining the military and political power of all subordinate kingdoms and clans in order to protect their common borders. To ensure an uncontested and unified power structure, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has pledged not to get involved in the internal dynastic politics of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] for the succeeding [Root.GetTitle] will be selected by the nobles and chieftans of the realm from hence forward. After the meeting chamber doors opened, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] announced that [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] was now truly united under one [Root.GetTitle]!

column2: Crown Prince Arthas Menethil of Lordaeron is the son of King Terenas Menethil II. The young Prince grew up as the First and Second War ravaged the continent, during this time he befriended King Varian Wrynn of Stormwind. Trained by Muradin Bronzebeard in combat, while his adopted uncle Uther the Lightbringer taught him the ways of the Light, he became a revered paladin in the Order of the Silver Hand. The romantic relationship with Lady Jaina Proudmoore caused a rivalry with Prince Kael'thas Sunstrider of Quel'Thalas by the elven prince's own interest in the young sorceress. However, the young prince is beloved by his people and would do anything to protect them. Even with his promising upbringing, a threat in the very heart of his kingdom will shake the foundations of his world.
column4: Kronprinz Arthas Menethil von Lordaeron ist der Sohn von K�nig Terenas Menethil II. Der junge Prinz wuchs auf, als der erste und zweite Krieg die Lande verw�steten. Von Muradin Bronzebart wurde er im Kampf ausgebildet, w�hrend sein Adoptivonkel Uther Lightbringer ihm die Wege des Lichts beibrachte und er ein gesch�tzter Paladin im Orden der Silberhand wurde. Die romantische Beziehung zu Lady Jaina Proudmoore f�hrte zu einer Rivalit�t mit Prinz Kael'thas Sunstrider von Quel'thalas, der selbst ein Interesse an der jungen Zauberin zeigte. Der bei seinem Volk sehr beliebte junge Prinz w�rde alles tun, um es zu besch�tzen. Selbst mit seiner vielversprechenden Erziehung k�nnte eine Bedrohung im Herzen seines K�nigreichs die Grundlagen seiner Welt ersch�ttern.

column2: Ner'zhul of the Shadowmoon clan, once it's chieftain and elder shaman, was one of the most respectable leaders among all of the orcish clans on Draenor, an advisor to all shamans regardless of their affiliation. Gul'dan, a powerful warlock had severed the connection to the elements on Draenor, thus not giving Ner'zhul the comfort of communicating with his deceased wife. His deep grief was soon preyed upon by Kil'jaeden, who began visiting his dreams as his departed wife, and he was told to form the Orcish Horde. Ner'zhul was turned into the Legion's pawn from the day he formed the Horde, and deceived into Kil'jaeden's realm, where he was torn apart and transformed into the Lich King.
column4: Ner'zhul vom Shadowmoon Clan, einst H�uptling und Schamanen�ltester, war einer der angesehensten F�hrer unter allen orkischen Clans auf Draenor, einem Ratgeber f�r alle Schamanen unabh�ngig von ihrer Herkunft. Gul'dan, ein m�chtiger Hexenmeister, hatte die Verbindung zu den Elementen auf Draenor unterbrochen und Ner'zhul so die M�glichkeit genommen, mit seiner verstorbenen Frau zu kommunizieren. Seine tiefe Trauer wurde bald von Kil'jaeden ausgenutzt, der begann, seine Tr�ume in Gestalt seiner verstorbenen Frau zu besuchen und er wurde aufgefordert, die orkische Horde zu formen. Ner'zhul wurde von dem Tag an, an dem er die Horde gr�ndete, zum Handlanger der Legion und in Kil'jaedens Reich gelockt, wo er in St�cke gerissen und in den Lichk�nig transformiert wurde.

column2: Lord Admiral Daelin Proudmoore is the ruler of the island nation of Kul Tiras, which was founded after the Troll Wars. Kul Tiras has the largest navy of the human kingdoms, with daring sailors and bold captains travelling across the seas, exploring the coasts of the Eastern Kingdoms. Just like his people, Daelin is a proud explorer and seafarer. And he will have a role to play in Azeroth's future.

Genau wie sein Volk ist Daelin ein stolzer Entdecker und Seefahrer. Und er wird eine Rolle f�r die Zukunft Azeroths spielen.

column2: Warchief Go'el, son of Durutan, was found by Aedelas Blackmoore who raised and trained him into a gladiator. After escaping Blackmoore's grasp, he fled into the wilderness of Lordaeron to find the remaining free orcs. When he found his people, he heard about the undefeated Grom Hellscream of the Warsong clan. A bond grew between the two orcs when they first met. Go'el then sought out the chieftain the Frostwolf clan, Drek'thar. Go'el was the first shaman accepted by the spirits since Drek'Thar's generation. Go'el became Warchief Doomhammer's second-in-command and after his death during the liberation of their people from the internment camps became the Warchief. Their people sailed across the seas, finding new allies and foes on their journey to Kalimdor where they established a new home for the Horde.
column4: Der Sohn von Durotan wurde von Aedelas Blackmoore gefunden, der ihn zu einem Gladiator ausgebildet hat. Nach seiner Flucht zog es ihn in die Wildnis von Lordaeron, um die restlichen freien Orks zu finden, als er vom unbesiegten Grom Hellscream des Warsong-Clans h�rte. Zwischen den Beiden entstand bereits bei ihrem ersten Treffen ein starkes Band. Go'el suchte daraufhin den H�uptling des Frostwolf-Clans Drek'thar auf. Seit dessen Generation war Go'el der erste Schamane, der von den Geistern akzeptiert wurde. Go'el wurde zu Kriegsh�uptling Doomhammers Stellvertreter und nach dessen Tod w�hrend der Befreiung ihres Volkes aus den Internierungslagern zum Kriegsh�uptling. column2: King Terenas Menethil II was born in the court of Lordaeron as a member of the royal family, that has ruled the Kingdom of Lordaeron for generations. Beloved by his people for his wise and just rule, bringing peace and prosperity during his long reign. However, with rumours of a new threat coming from beyond Azeroth and as the ruler of the largest human kingdom, Terenas must prepare his banners for war as the very fate of this world could very well be in his hands. column2: [target_warchief.GetBestName] has announced the start of a recruitment drive intended to assemble the Horde's greatest warriors for a new elite guard commanded by the Warchief: the Kor'kron. This unit of brave and ferocious soldiers is supposedly dedicated to protecting the very mission statement of the Horde and what it stands for, though it comes with a small caveat: it is directly subordinate to the Warchief, who shall personally handpick [target_warchief.GetHerHis] guard, almost exclusively from [target_warchief.GetHerHis] fellow orcs. This has not gone unnoticed by the rest of the Horde's members. They are already calling the Kor'kron the "Warchief's Praetorian" or "personal guards", and there is a general consensus that it is unlikely that the Kor'kron will defend the common interests and beliefs of the Horde's other members.

column2: This character has a felhound minion. Felhounds are ugly, red, spined creatures from the depths of the Twisting Nether. Felhounds are demon hounds used by the pit lords to sniff out sources of magic wherever they be found. Felhounds, who feed upon magic itself, are fond of draining the energies of hapless wizards and then ripping their bodies to shreds.

column2: This character has a felguard minion. Felguard are demons of the mo'arg race that serve as the Legion's rank and file demonic soldiers and front-line troops. They are fearless and unwaveringly loyal to their master's godlike will. They are almost always seen with heavy, two-handed weaponry. They are slow to strike, but hit quite hard, and are more agile than they look.

column2: A long time ago, the land now known as the Howling Fjord was ruled by the Dragonflayers, a vrykul clan under the leadership of King Ymiron, a true legend among the vrykul. He and his champions attacked and drove the jalgar, the vrykul's mortal enemy, into Kalimdor's lush forests. Yet on the heels of this victory, tragedy struck. The Curse of Flesh struck the vrykul, with devastating effects.\nThe Dragonflayers attempted and struggled to purge themselves of the Curse of Flesh in several ways. Eventually, these vrykul would place themselves in hibernation in the hopes of staving off the Curse of Flesh.\nNow a thousand years later, King Ymiron and his warriors has been awakened by [Root.GetTitledFirstName] with a burning desire to retake what was rightfully his: the Howling Fjord.
column4: Vor langer Zeit wurde das Land, das heute als heulender Fjord bekannt ist, von den Drachenschindern regiert, einem Vrykul-Clan unter der F�hrung von K�nig Ymiron, einer wahren Legende unter den Vrykul. Er und seine Krieger griffen die Jalgar, die Todfeinde der Vrykul, an und trieben sie in die �ppigen W�lder von Kalimdor. Doch nach diesem Sieg kam es zu einer Trag�die. Der Fluch des Fleisches nahm seinen Lauf.\nDie Drachenschinder versuchten auf unterschiedliche Weisen, sich vom Fluch des Fleisches zu reinigen. Schlie�lich verfielen diese Vrykul in der Hoffnung, den Fluch des Fleisches abzuwenden, in einen Winterschlaf. Tausend Jahre sp�ter wurden K�nig Ymiron und seine Krieger von [Root.GetTitledFirstName] mit dem brennenden Wunsch geweckt, das zur�ckzuholen, was ihnen im Schlaf genommen wurde: den heulenden Fjord.

column2: Is imprisoned within the Frozen Throne

The [target_lich_king.GetTitle] is getting weaker, and [target_lich_king.GetHerHis] power is constantly seeping out of the Frozen Throne. In order to prevent the Scourge from being undone, immediate action needs to be taken. As the Champion of the Scourge and wielder of Frostmourne, you must venture to Icecrown Glacier and ascend to the Frozen Throne. Then, claim the Helm of Domination to become the new host for the demigod and solidify control over the legions of undead lest they become a mindless horde.

column2: After what feels like a month has gone by, you have once again dropped anchor in Northrend. As you set foot on dry land, memories of your last journey here come flooding back into your mind.\nYou remember when you first set down in Daggercap with your men. You remember having decided to stop at nothing to destroy the Dark Lord and avenge the lives of your countrymen. The dreaded blade that made your vengeance possible cost you everything: your men, your friends, your sanity...\nIn the end, it did not matter. You were willing to pay any price to save your people[Root.GetChampionGuilt]. You shove these thoughts back into the recesses of your mind, trudging ever forward into the frozen wastes.
column4: Nachdem ein Monat vergangen ist, habt Ihr in Northrend erneut Anker geworfen. Als Ihr den Fu� auf das Festland setztet kommen die Erinnerungen an Eure letzte Reise hierher zur�ck. Ihr erinnert Euch, als Ihr mit Euren M�nnern zum ersten Mal in Daggercap abgelegt habt. Ihr erinnert Euch daran, dass Ihr beschlossen habt, vor nichts Halt zu machen, um den dunklen Lord zu vernichten und das Leben Eurer Landsleute zu r�chen. Die gef�rchtete Klinge, die Eure Rache erm�glichte, hat Euch alles gekostet: Eure M�nner, Eure Freunde, Euren Verstand ... Am Ende war es egal. Ihr wart bereit, jeden Preis zu zahlen, um Euer Volk zu retten [Root.GetChampionGuilt]. Ihr schiebt diese Gedanken zur�ck in die Tiefen Eures Geistes und stapft immer weiter in die gefrorene Ein�de.

column2: I am different now. I cannot let my own past hold me back now.
column4: Ich bin jetzt anders. Ich kann mich jetzt nicht von meiner eigenen Vergangenheit zur�ckhalten lassen.

column2: Here it is, the frozen spire hidden within the wastes of Northrend. It is hard to believe anything could find its home here in such a desolate place, but it seems almost perfectly appropriate for the Lord and Jailer of the Damned. You begin your ascent to the top of this tower. Memories of your [Root.GetChampionKilledCharacter] flood your mind, and the closer you get, the closer salvation seems to be. You reach the top, and a voice penetrates your mind,\n"Return the blade, complete the circle, release me from this prison!"\nWithout hesitation, you shatter the diamond ice that encases the Helm of Domination imprisoning [target_lich_king.GetFirstName]'s soul. As the ice breaks apart, the helm falls at your feet, almost as if it beckons you. You proceed to pick up the crown with both hands as it thrums with power and place it upon your head. There is only one obstacle left in your way.
column4: Hier ist er, der vereiste Turm, der in den Ein�den von Northrend versteckt ist. Es ist kaum zu glauben, dass hier an einem so trostlosen Ort irgendetwas sein Zuhause finden k�nnte, aber es scheint dem Herrn und Kerkermeister der Verdammten angemessen zu sein. Ihr beginnt Euren Aufstieg zur Spitze des Turms. Erinnerungen an Euren [Root.GetChampionKilledCharacter] �berfluten Euren Geist, und je n�her Ihr kommt, desto n�her scheint die Erl�sung zu sein. Ihr erreicht die Spitze, und eine Stimme dringt in Euren Geist ein: "Gebt die Klinge zur�ck, schlie�t den Kreis, befreit mich aus diesem Gef�ngnis!" Ohne z�gern zerschmettert Ihr das diamantharte Eis, das den Helm der Herrschaft umgibt und die Seele von [target_lich_king.GetFirstName] gefangen h�lt. Als das Eis auseinander bricht, f�llt der Helm zu Euren F��en, fast so, als ob er Euch auffordert. Ihr ergreift die Krone mit beiden H�nden, w�hrend sie vor Kraft schwingt, und setzt sie auf Euren Kopf. Es gibt nur noch ein Hindernis, das Euch im Weg steht.

column2: They started out weak and faint, seemingly just random daydreams and thoughts entering and leaving your mind in less than a second. Recently, they have become stronger, almost as if they are a part of your reality. One of these visions stands out amongst the rest, and it takes almost complete control of you. A malevolent voice whispers to you from the back of your head, but another voice rises to meet it, the remains of your very humanity.\n\nIn the end, one of these voices will overcome the other and your intervention will be the deciding factor in choosing the victor. One of these entities shall win the day, and giving in to one of them seems to be the only path to retaining your sanity.
column4: Sie begannen zun�chst schwach, scheinbar nur zuf�llige Tagtr�ume und Gedanken, die nur kurz aufblitzten. In letzter Zeit sind diese Visionen st�rker geworden, fast so, als w�ren sie ein Teil Eurer Realit�t. Eine dieser Visionen hebt sich von den anderen ab, und sie �bernimmt fast die vollst�ndige Kontrolle �ber Euch. Eine b�swillige Stimme fl�stert Euch aus dem Hinterkopf zu, aber eine andere Stimme erhebt sich, um ihr entgegenzutreten, die �berreste Eurer Menschlichkeit.\n\n Am Ende wird eine dieser Stimmen die andere �berwinden, und Euer Eingreifen wird der entscheidende Faktor bei der Wahl des Siegers sein. Eine dieser Entit�ten wird den Sieg davontragen, und der einzige Weg, wie Ihr Eure Zurechnungsf�higkeit bewahren k�nnt, scheint der zu sein, dass Ihr Euch einer dieser Stimmen unterwerfen m�sst.

column2: In an instant the dream that overtook your mind ends. You find yourself having collapsed to the ground winded and gasping for air. The dominance of [target_lich_king.GetFirstName] has come to an end, and now you are in absolute control of your destiny. Even so, with all the power that the Lich King had, why is it after all you have experienced you still find yourself weakened by what once made you alive?\n\nAt the edge of the bottomless abyss, you have the opportunity to remove the last portion of you that holds back your potential, the beating organ that sustains whatever else may still be alive in your broken vessel.

Dennoch, bei all der Macht, die der Lichk�nig hatte, warum findet Ihr Euch nach allem, was Ihr erlebt habt, immer noch geschw�cht von dem, was Euch einst zum Leben erweckte? Am Rande des bodenlosen Abgrunds habt Ihr die M�glichkeit, den letzten Teil von Euch zu entfernen, der Euer Potential zur�ckh�lt, das schlagende Organ, das alles aufrechterh�lt, was in Eurem zerbrochenen Gef�� noch am Leben sein mag.

column2:
After a long and costly war, with many brave and valiant lives lost, the Lich King and his Scourge have been defeated, and the dead rest in peace once more.

Friends and family of the dead can finally bury the twisted and disfigured corpses of their loved ones, their grief no longer accompanied by the horror that the one they knew in life was serving evil after death. With the Lich King's demise, a new era dawns over Azeroth.

Nevertheless, his dark shadow continues to loom over the world, whether in the memories of veterans, tales told to scare children, or wicked death cults seeking to revive his undead empire.
column4:
Nach einem langen und kostspieligen Krieg, in dem viele tapfere und mutige Menschen ihr Leben verloren haben, sind der Lichk�nig und seine Gei�el besiegt worden, und die Toten k�nnen endlich wieder in Frieden ruhen.

Freunde und Familie der Toten k�nnen endlich die verdrehten und entstellten Leichen ihrer Lieben begraben, ihre Trauer wird nicht mehr von dem Schrecken begleitet, dass derjenige, den sie im Leben gekannt haben, nach dem Tod dem B�sen dient. Mit dem Untergang des Lichk�nigs bricht eine neue �ra �ber Azeroth an.
Trotzdem liegt sein dunkler Schatten nach wie vor �ber der Welt, sei es in den Erinnerungen von Veteranen, in Geschichten, die erz�hlt werden, um Kinder zu erschrecken, oder in b�sen Todeskulten, die versuchen, sein untotes Reich wiederzubeleben.

column2: Azeroth is still reeling from the devastation caused by the horrors of the Third War. The kingdoms of northern Azeroth lie in ruins, consumed by the relentless march of the undead Scourge. The forests of Kalimdor bear the horrible taint of the demonic Burning Legion, despite their spectacular defeat at the summit of Mount Hyjal. Nevertheless, new developments occur as the orcs finally begin to settle the red sands of Durotar and the fractured Alliance deals with threats on every front, including domestic ones. The undead Scourge is also in dire straits, as the Illidari return to Azeroth in order to finish the job they started in Dalaran, while the undead forces in Lordaeron are on the brink of civil war...
column4: Azeroth leidet noch immer unter den Verw�stungen, die die Schrecken des dritten Krieges verursacht haben. Die K�nigreiche im Norden Azeroths liegen in Tr�mmern, verzehrt vom unerbittlichen Marsch der untoten Gei�el. Die W�lder von Kalimdor leiden unter dem furchtbaren Einfluss der d�monischen brennenden Legion, trotz deren spektakul�rer Niederlage auf dem Gipfel des Berges Hyjal. Gleichwohl kommt es zu neuen Entwicklungen, da die Orks endlich beginnen, die roten Sande von Durotar zu besiedeln, und die zerbrochene Allianz mit Bedrohungen an allen Fronten, auch im Inland, fertig werden muss. Auch die Gei�el der Untoten befindet sich in einer ernsten Notlage, da die Illidari nach Azeroth zur�ckkehren, um ihre in Dalaran begonnene Arbeit zu beenden, w�hrend die untoten Streitkr�fte in Lordaeron am Rande eines B�rgerkriegs stehen...

column2: In recent months, the leadership of the Scourge had been thrown into disarray due to the damage inflicted to the Lich King's icy prison through Illidan Stormrage's tampering with the Eye of Sargeras. This has led to splinter factions of undead emerging within Tirisfal Glades, while Scourge loyalists were pushed back eastwards and their champion recalled to Northrend to repel the Illidari armies converging upon the glacier of Icecrown. Seeing the chaos as a golden opportunity to reclaim the heartland, the human vestige in Silverpine Forest prepares for the final confrontation with the undead, but there are concerns about the future of the kingdom should they come out victorious in their campaign, as the fate of the last living heir is still unclear to the chain of command, making it difficult to decide to whom should the crown of Lordaeron ultimately go...
column4: In den letzten Monaten war die F�hrung der Gei�el durch den Schaden, der dem eisigen Gef�ngnis des Lichk�nigs durch die Manipulation des Auges von Sargeras durch Illidan Stormrage zugef�gt wurde, in Unordnung geraten. Dies hat dazu gef�hrt, dass in den Tirisfal-Gletschern Splittergruppen von Untoten auftauchten, w�hrend Loyalisten der Gei�el nach Osten zur�ckgedr�ngt wurden und ihr Champion nach Northrend zur�ckgerufen wurde, um die auf den Eiskronegletscher marschierenden Armeen der Illidari zur�ckzuschlagen. Die menschlichen �berreste im Silberkiefernwald sehen das Chaos als eine goldene Gelegenheit, das Kernland zur�ckzuerobern, und bereiten sich auf die endg�ltige Konfrontation mit den Untoten vor, aber es gibt Bedenken �ber die Zukunft des K�nigreichs, falls sie aus ihrem Feldzug als Sieger hervorgehen sollten, da f�r die Kommandeure das Schicksal des letzten lebenden Erben noch immer unklar ist, was es schwierig macht, zu entscheiden, an wen die Krone von Lordaeron letztendlich gehen soll...

column2: The long struggle for the heart of Lordaeron is over. With the last undead holdout within the Capital City culled by the human resistance, the entire city has completely fallen under the control of the forces loyal to the Grand Marshal Garithos. In the meantime, resistance scouts have learned of the whereabouts of Princess Calia from a source that wished to remain anonymous. The princess herself was reluctant to accept the crown, but ultimately chose to lead her people in their hour of need and was crowned in a private ceremony. Lord Garithos himself swore an oath of service to Queen Calia and was subsequently declared a hero of Lordaeron for his role in the reclamation of the capital. The Alliance immediately sent envoys to re-establish proper relations with the kingdom - a ray of hope for the future after countless days of war, death, and sorrow.
column4: Der lange Kampf um das Herz von Lordaeron ist vorbei. Mit dem letzten untoten Widerstandsnest innerhalb der Hauptstadt, das durch den menschlichen Widerstand niedergeschlagen wurde, ist die gesamte Stadt vollst�ndig unter die Kontrolle der Gro�marschall Garithos treuen Kr�fte geraten. In der Zwischenzeit haben die Sp�her des Widerstands den Verbleib von Prinzessin Calia aus einer anonymen Quelle erfahren. Die Prinzessin selbst z�gerte, die Krone anzunehmen, entschied sich aber schlie�lich dazu, ihr Volk in der Stunde der Not zu f�hren und wurde in einer privaten Zeremonie gekr�nt. Lord Garithos selbst schwor K�nigin Calia einen Eid und wurde anschlie�end f�r seine Rolle bei der R�ckgewinnung der Hauptstadt zum Helden von Lordaeron erkl�rt. Die Allianz entsandte unverz�glich Botschafter, um die angemessenen Beziehungen zum K�nigreich wiederherzustellen - ein Hoffnungsschimmer f�r die Zukunft nach unz�hligen Tagen des Krieges, des Todes und der Trauer.

column2: With the restoration of Menethil rule in Lordaeron becoming a fait accompli, the paladins of the Silver Hand are now pondering the future of the Order as an independent entity as the struggle against the Scourge continues in the earnest. Because the entire history of the Silver Hand was strongly intertwined with the Alliance, many advocate its continued affiliation with the kingdom, and by extension the entire faction. However, recently there have been some dissenting voices as well, particularly from the faction in the east that believes the nature of the conflict in the Plaguelands is purely spiritual and reaffirming the ties to a political faction would be seen as a discrimination for the righteous representatives of the races that are regarded as Alliance's enemies, such as the orcs, trolls or even free-willed undead. With a potential split looming over the order, the Highlord has to decide the course of action that will ultimately decide the fate of Lordaeronian paladins.
column4: Nachdem die Wiederherstellung der Menethil-Herrschaft in Lordaeron zu einer vollendeten Tatsache geworden ist, denken die Paladine der Silbernen Hand nun �ber die Zukunft des Ordens als unabh�ngige Einheit nach, w�hrend der Kampf gegen die Gei�el unver�ndert weitergeht. Da die gesamte Geschichte der Silbernen Hand eng mit der Allianz verflochten war, bef�rworten viele ihre fortgesetzte Zugeh�rigkeit zum K�nigreich und damit auch zur gesamten Fraktion. In j�ngster Zeit gibt es jedoch auch einige abweichende Stimmen, insbesondere aus der Fraktion im Osten, die der Ansicht sind, dass der Konflikt in den Pestl�ndern rein spiritueller Natur ist und die Bekr�ftigung der Verbindungen zu einer politischen Fraktion als Diskriminierung der rechtschaffenen Vertreter der Rassen angesehen w�rde, die als Feinde des B�ndnisses angesehen werden, wie z.B. der Orks, der Trolle oder sogar der freien Untoten. Da sich eine m�gliche Spaltung des Ordens abzeichnet, muss der Hochlord �ber die Vorgehensweise entscheiden, die letztlich �ber das Schicksal der lordaeronischen Paladine entscheidet.

column2: The Silver Hand will remain neutral.

column2: Despite long negotiations, the loyalist and independence factions of the Silver Hand were unable to strike a compromise, effectively ending any hope for a continued existence of a united paladin order, which many observers regard as a major setback to the war effort against the Scourge in the Plaguelands.\nThe loyalist faction has sworn fealty to the recently crowned Queen Calia of Lordaeron and resumes their duties to the Alliance as it has always done in the past. The independence faction which was comprised mostly out of the eastern knights and landlords has formed a new order that calls itself the Argent Dawn. They maintain a policy of open arms to anyone willing to aid in their crusade against evil and strongly oppose any involvement in political affairs, having proclaimed total neutrality.
column4: Trotz langer Verhandlungen konnten die Loyalisten- und die Unabh�ngigkeitsfraktion der Silbernen Hand keinen Kompromiss erzielen und damit die Hoffnung auf das Fortbestehen eines geeinten Paladin-Ordens zunichte machen, was viele Beobachter als gro�en R�ckschlag f�r die Kriegsanstrengungen gegen die Gei�el in den Pestl�ndern ansehen.\nDie loyalistische Fraktion hat der k�rzlich gekr�nten K�nigin Calia von Lordaeron Treue geschworen und nimmt ihre Pflichten gegen�ber der Allianz wieder auf, wie sie es in der Vergangenheit immer getan hat. Sie verfolgt eine Politik der offenen Arme f�r jeden, der bereit ist, ihnen bei ihrem Kreuzzug gegen das B�se zu helfen, und lehnt jede Beteiligung an politischen Angelegenheiten entschieden ab, wobei sie die v�llige Neutralit�t verk�ndet hat.

column2: This foolish bickering makes them easier targets.

column2: The long struggle for the heart of Lordaeron is over. With the last undead holdout within the Capital City culled by the human resistance, the entire city has completely fallen under control of the forces loyal to the Grand Marshal Garithos. The victorious warlord marched into the city and proclaimed himself the new ruler of Lordaeron, a deed that wasn't much of a surprise to his men, but sent a major shockwave among the Alliance, especially the non-human members who have learned of his xenophobic policies, leading to the faction proclaiming the takeover as unlawful and ordered Garithos to vacate the throne immediately, an order he refused as he claimed the throne is his by "right and deed". The paladins have also condemned the actions of the usurper, but apparently there is a faction that silently approves the new course for the kingdom. Only time will tell what will come out of this.
column4: Der lange Kampf um das Herz von Lordaeron ist vorbei. Der siegreiche Kriegsherr marschierte in die Stadt ein und erkl�rte sich selbst zum neuen Herrscher von Lordaeron, eine Tat, die f�r seine M�nner keine gro�e �berraschung darstellte, aber eine starke Schockwelle in der Allianz ausl�ste, vor allem bei den nichtmenschlichen Mitgliedern, die von seiner fremdenfeindlichen Politik erfahren haben, was dazu f�hrte, dass die Fraktion die �bernahme als unrechtm��ig erkl�rte und Garithos aufforderte, den Thron sofort zu r�umen, was er verweigerte, da er behauptete, der Thron geh�re ihm durch �Recht und Tat�. Die Paladine haben auch die Handlungen des Usurpators verurteilt, aber offenbar gibt es eine Fraktion, die den neuen Kurs f�r das K�nigreich stillschweigend billigt. Nur die Zeit wird zeigen, was dabei herauskommen wird.

column2: Many in the Silver Hand disapproved of the unlawful assumption of rule over the [k_lordaeron.GetFullBaseName] by [k_lordaeron.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]. However, there is a faction of sympathizers within the order whose views on superiority of humans over what they deemed as "lesser races" are closely aligned with those of [k_lordaeron.Holder.GetLastWordInDynastyName]' own: the Scarlet faction of [d_scarlet_crusade.Holder.GetTitledFirstName].\n\nHaving recognized [k_lordaeron.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] as the true King of [k_lordaeron.GetName] and the only hope against the Scourge, the followers of [d_scarlet_crusade.Holder.GetLastWordInDynastyName] have renounced the Silver Hand and went on to form a heavily militant doctrine of the Light faith, with the new order, the Scarlet Crusade, as its chief arm.

column2: [Root.GetStartWCLAT9001], most within the order have become more zealous and fanatic in their mission to eradicate the unholy beings of Lordaeron and beyond, transforming a large part of this once noble order into a vicious and xenophobic crusade against all unholy beings and what are considered lesser races.\nSome, however, chose not to take this path guided by [d_scarlet_crusade.Holder.GetTitledFirstName], instead choosing to go their own way under the leadership of [d_argent_dawn.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] to form the Argent Dawn. These noble warriors of the Light preach a more cosmopolitan order in contrast to that of their xenophobic brethren. Meanwhile, the fanatics of [d_scarlet_crusade.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] have rebranded themselves as the Scarlet Crusade. What still remains of the Silver Hand keeps to itself within the bastions of Khaz Modan and Azeroth.

column2: The three-way civil war in the Plaguelands has finally come to a conclusion. The once living and thriving bastion of humanity, Capital City, fell into the hands of Lady Sylvanas Windrunner.\n\nShe has managed to come out on top despite all odds with her skillful political maneuvers and sly schemes by turning her enemies against one another. She has carved out a new nation within the Plaguelands and thus became the undisputed ruler of Capital City. With the conquest of Capital City, she declared her defection from the Scourge and named her people the "Forsaken", vowing to slaughter all who stand in the way of their destiny.

column2:
With every battle between the Illidari and the Scourge, [target_illidan.GetFirstName] watched more of [target_illidan.GetHerHis] soldiers fall before the undead hordes, only to be raised as part of the enemy's unholy army.

Finding their foe demoralized and vulnerable, the Scourge led a decisive assault on the Illidari, driving [target_illidan.GetFirstName] to call for a retreat through portals to the planet once known as Draenor, today commonly known as Outland.

With the Illidari regrouping, many of their allies were left without reinforcements, meeting a cruel and untimely demise from either the brutal Northrend cold, or the merciless hands of the undead.

column2: Lady Jaina Proudmoore, the young ruler of Theramore and hero of the Third War, faces a difficult choice. Jaina has been drawn into a war between her father, Lord Admiral Daelin Proudmoore of Kul Tiras, and her former allies of the Horde, who she fought alongside against the Burning Legion. A pacifist at heart, she is uncomfortable with conflict. The situation is made all the more complicated by her newfound friendship with Thrall, Warchief of the Horde. However, neither side is willing to negotiate, and it seems all but certain that Jaina will be forced to choose between her family and her newfound friends. There are no easy choices here for the young Lady of Theramore.
column4: Lady Jaina Proudmoore, die junge Herrscherin von Theramore und Heldin des Dritten Krieges, steht vor einer schwierigen Wahl. Jaina wurde in einen Krieg zwischen ihrem Vater, Gro�admiral Daelin Proudmoore von Kul Tiras, und ihren ehemaligen Verb�ndeten der Horde, an deren Seite sie gegen die brennende Legion gek�mpft hatte, hineingezogen. Als �berzeugte Pazifistin f�hlt sie sich in Konflikten nicht wohl. Die Situation wird durch ihre neu gewonnene Freundschaft zu Thrall, dem Kriegsh�uptling der Horde, noch komplizierter. Keine der beiden Seiten ist jedoch zu Verhandlungen bereit, und es scheint so gut wie sicher, dass Jaina gezwungen sein wird, zwischen ihrer Familie und ihren neu gewonnenen Freunden zu w�hlen. column2: Grand Marshal Othmar Garithos, leader of the remnants of the Alliance of Lordaeron, grew up in the small town of Blackwood. Othmar didn't necessarily get to his position due to his skills or abilities within the military, but because of his father's reputation. With the fall of Lordaeron by the Scourge, he became the strongest human warlord in the area and recognized by the Alliance as the last potential and stable government of what once was Lordaeron. Under his leadership however, the alliance with the Elves of Quel'Thalas has soured through his bigoted and racist views. With a brutal civil war looming in the air within the Plaguelands, Othmar must ensure humanity's foothold in Lordaeron by reconquering Capital City and reinstating a rightful ruler.
column4: Gro�marschall Othmar Garithos, Anf�hrer der �berreste der Allianz von Lordaeron, wuchs in der kleinen Stadt Blackwood auf. Othmar kam nicht gerade wegen seiner F�higkeiten und Fertigkeiten innerhalb des Milit�rs zu seiner Position, sondern wegen des Rufs seines Vaters. Mit dem Sturz Lordaerons durch die Gei�el wurde er zum st�rksten menschlichen Kriegsherrn in der Region und von der Allianz als letzte potenzielle und stabile Regierung des einstigen Lordaeron anerkannt. column2: Prince Kael'thas Sunstrider lost nearly everything. The Scourge invasion caused widespread destruction in Quel'Thalas, the death of his father, and, most devastating of all, the desecration of the Sunwell. In the aftermath of the war, the Prince returned to his kingdom, only to find his brethren suffering from magical withdrawal due to the loss of the Sunwell. Kael'thas left Quel'Thalas to find a cure for his people. Although he first looked to the Alliance for aid, difficulties arose from Lord Garithos' distaste for his kind, leading to Kael'thas' imprisonment, where Lady Vashj lent him a helping hand. She later brought him to Illidan Stormrage, who promised Kael'thas a cure in exchange for his aid. Now, Kael'thas stands beside Illidan in a desperate bid to destroy the Lich King and to find a cure for his people.
column4: Prinz Kael'thas Sunstrider hat nahezu alles verloren � die Zerst�rung seines Heimatlandes durch die Invasion der Gei�el, der Tod seines Vaters und, am verheerendsten von allen, die Sch�ndung des Sonnenbrunnens. column2: Lady Sylvanas Windrunner, the former Ranger-General of Silvermoon, used to be a ferocious fighter before her death by Prince Arthas Menethil, and still is in her undeath. With an iron will she has managed to break free from the Lich King's grasp. As the bulk of the Scourge forces are thinning in Lordaeron to deal with a threat to the Frozen Throne, Sylvanas Windrunner and her rebellion are running amok. The Forsaken heartland in Tirisfal Glades is in a quite terrible position. With enemies surrounding it, the Forsaken struggle in their survival and are in dire need of a way to ease the pressure. With that, Sylvanas has set her sight upon Capital City, due to its strategic value in being a chokepoint to Silverpine Forest. Their fate depends on the capture of Capital City, for without it their fate is less certain.

W�hrend der Gro�teil der Streitkr�fte der Gei�el zur�ckgezogen wird, um einer Bedrohung des Frostthrons zu begegnen, sieht Lady Sylvanas die Zeit f�r ihre Rebellion gekommen. column2: Illidan was imprisoned for nearly ten thousand years in solitude under the watch of the Wardens, when he was released by his love, Tyrande. Tyrande believed him to be an indispensable asset to the Legion's defeat, which he indeed proved but at the cost of his people's trust and mortal soul. After his banishment, Kil'jaeden sought him out with an offer. Illidan was tasked to destroy the Lich King. He attempted to use the Eye of Sargeras in Dalaran to cast a cataclysmic spell, but was thwarted. Fearing the wrath of Kil'jaeden he fled to the shattered remnants of Draenor, but despite his efforts he was found and Illidan accepted the deal once again. In one final endeavor with his followers, he shall march into the frozen valley of death where the living dare not tread, facing countless hordes of scourge fiends.

column2: Recently, the illness, that has befallen [target_sick_spouse.GetFirstName] has been growing worse with each passing day. Knowing well that [target_sick_spouse.GetSheHe] might not last another week, you have sought many solutions, be it magical or alchemical, but nothing seems to help alleviate [target_sick_spouse.GetHerHis] condition. The grief over your inevitable loss overcomes you, and in desperation you cry out in hopes that something or someone will hear your pleas. To your surprise, a shadowy figure emerges and makes you a promise that death will never part you and your spouse... for a price. It offers you unimaginable power and eternal life in exchange for loyalty and you realize this might be the only way to keep your beloved at your side. Conflicting thoughts cross your mind, but you ultimately realise that if death can part you both...

column2: Your illness has been progressing in a steady pace and you've already been coming to terms that you might not survive. However, one day you notice [target_worried_spouse.GetFirstName] entering your chambers and immediately recognize that [target_worried_spouse.GetSheHe]'s unusually cheerful. Suddenly, you see a horrific spectre looming above. "Don't be startled, dear. I have found a solution for your illness. You no longer have to worry about leaving me alone here... We'll be together forever." You attempt to flee, but you notice that dark magic is binding you. You hear your spouse chanting something in an unrecognisable language and after a brief moment of darkness, you come back to your senses, although you notice that something has changed. You are dead, but at the same time you are not. As you struggle to understand your situation, you notice that your significant one also became afflicted.

column2: Disturbing news have reached us from Drustvar. The ruling elite has gone dark and no one is entirely sure what is happening in the region. The food supplies to the rest of Kul Tiras were suddenly cut and people apparently started disappearing, while rumours abound of shadowy covens lurking in the darkest recesses of Drustvar's forests, corrupting the land and its populace. Many believe that the strange occurences are caused by an ancient curse which has befallen the ruling house of Drustvar. To counter whatever this new threat might be an inquisition comprised of many battle-hardened champions from the Admiralty and beyond has been called to action. They call themselves the Order of Embers.

column2: With Drustvar completely under control of the agents of Thros, the hopes of the inhabitants of Kul Tiras grow dim. As the local populace of Drustvar continues to fall prey to the foul presence permeating the land, the corrupted elite has managed to gather enough power to summon their dark master to the material plane. The ominous island of Fate's End stirs as the ancient drust king, Gorak Tul has re-entered Azeroth and now has set his sights upon the outlanders inhabiting Kul Tiras, which he regards as an infestation upon the ancestral land of the drust.

column2: Whether it's at the Tirnas or in Tiras, they know no rest, nor peace.

column2: The jewel of Kul Tiras has fallen to the relentless onslaught of the vengeful drust. Thousands of citizens were slaughtered or raised into undeath while nearly all of Boralus' riches were pillaged by the savage barbarians. The flames that have engulfed the once proud capital can be seen from seaside cities in the Eastern Kingdoms. Many wonder what fate awaits the islands, now that the victory of the drust seems inevitable, and the continental powers are already expecting potential future aggression from the recent conquerors of Kul Tiras.

column2: Our invincible forces have descended upon Boralus. Despite the best attempts at defense, the inhabitants of the city were no match to our mighty warriors and as soon as we broke through their ranks, we stormed the streets of their stronghold and began the slaughter. Our deathshapers raised the fallen against the remaining defenders, while our troops pillaged everything they found valuable. It is safe to say, that, by the end of the day, nothing will remain of Boralus other than a painful memory for the outlanders and a glorious victory for our people.

column2: With the renewed aggression of the agents of Thros, their ancient opposition has emerged from the shadows. Considering the ilk of Gorak Tul as a mockery to everything the ancient drust stood for, the druidic Thornspeakers have managed to slip away from Kul Tiras and established relations with their like-minded kin near Tal'doren, hoping to preserve the centuries-old teachings for new generations of uncorrupted drust and other followers of the Old Way alike.

column2: The Heartsbane Coven has been formed
Creation of the Blood Knights Order

After many centuries of fighting against trolls and other foes, the high elves established a new Empire from the bones of their enemies for all of the world to envy. Quel'Thalas, the eversummer land, now is threatened by new enemies. Trolls seeking vengeance for their bretheren, vile undead trying to complete their master's plan, evil demons trying to destroy Azeroth and awakened Old Gods. All trying to destroy the new home of the elves, even xenophobic humans want to see Quel'Thalas burn. No longer able to wait passively, [From.GetFirstName] created the Blood Knights' Order, an order of elven paladins that will help defend Quel'Thalas and the Sunwell against any outside threat. All around the realm paladins bring their weapons and faith to Silvermoon City and join the ranks of the Blood Knights. The Light shines above Silvermoon City.
column4: Nach vielen Jahrhunderten des Kampfes gegen Trolle und andere Feinde errichteten die Hochelfen auf den Knochen ihrer Feinde ein neues Reich, um das sie alle Welt beneiden sollte. Quel'Thalas, das Immersommerland, ist nun von neuen Feinden bedroht. Alle versuchen, die neue Heimat der Elfen zu zerst�ren, selbst fremdenfeindliche Menschen wollen Quel'Thalas brennen sehen. Da [From.GetSheHe] dies nicht l�nger unt�tig beobachten kann, gr�ndete [From.GetFirstName] den Orden der Blutritter, einen Orden von elfischen Paladinen, der Quel'Thalas und den Sonnenbrunnen gegen jede Bedrohung von au�en verteidigen soll. Im gesamten Reich bringen Paladine ihre Waffen und ihren Glauben nach Silvermoon und schlie�en sich den R�ngen der Blutritter an. Das Licht leuchtet �ber Silvermoon.

column2: The imperial ogres were the greatest power on Draenor, before their fateful attempt to subdue the elements. Today, many ogres gathered in the great hall of [target_new_goria.GetName] to discuss the future of their beleaguered race. The elders formed a senate and acknowledged their host, [target_imperator.GetFirstName], as the [target_imperator.GetTitle] of the ogres. In [target_imperator.GetHerHis] speech to the many clansmen gathered outside of the hall, [target_imperator.GetSheHe] proclaims a new destiny for [target_imperator.GetHerHis] people.\n"No longer will we live in mounds dug in the backwater corners of this world. WE ruled Draenor. WE forged an empire. WE took on the world and here we stand. Smash those who oppose us! Glory to the Gorian Empire!"\nWith these words the gathered clansmen cheered, the purple-gold banners of old unfurled in the sky. The Gorian Empire is reborn. Finally the ogres will claim their rightful place among the proud races of Azeroth.

column2: Elune is a complicated goddess. She is generous and just, kind, but vindictive. Just like us she has light and dark sides. Her light aspect, called the Moon Mother, favours priests and diplomats who prevent meaningless bloodshed. Her dark aspect, called the Night Warrior, favours nightblades and warriors who are ready to sacrifice everything in the name of her justice.
